Liberty Jail, Missouri
Nauvoo Temple, Illinois
Palmyra, New York
correct_answer: Carthage Jail, Illinois
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 135 reports the martyrdom of Joseph and Hyrum Smith in Carthage Jail, Illinois, on June 27, 1844.

topic: Joseph Smith’s Teachings about Priesthood, Temple, and Women
question_text: According to Joseph Smith’s teaching in Doctrine and Covenants 131, what is required to obtain the highest degree of the celestial kingdom?
answers: Entering into the new and everlasting covenant of marriage (eternal marriage) sealed by proper authority
Being baptized for the dead on behalf of ancestors
Receiving ordination to the Aaronic Priesthood
Partaking of the sacrament weekly
correct_answer: Entering into the new and everlasting covenant of marriage (eternal marriage) sealed by proper authority
explanation: D&C 131:1–4 teaches that to obtain the highest degree of the celestial kingdom, one must enter into the new and everlasting covenant of marriage, which is a temple sealing performed by proper priesthood authority.

topic: Joseph Smith’s Teachings about Priesthood, Temple, and Women
question_text: What did Joseph Smith teach in Nauvoo about women laying hands on the sick?
answers: Women could lay hands on the sick and pray by faith for healing, consistent with spiritual gifts, while priesthood offices remained reserved to men
Only Melchizedek Priesthood holders could lay hands on the sick under any circumstances
Women could independently perform all ordinances of healing, including confirmations, without priesthood direction
Women were forbidden from participating in any form of healing prayer
correct_answer: Women could lay hands on the sick and pray by faith for healing, consistent with spiritual gifts, while priesthood offices remained reserved to men
explanation: Nauvoo Relief Society minutes and the Church’s Gospel Topics essay state that Joseph Smith approved women laying hands on the sick by faith as an exercise of spiritual gifts, without conferring priesthood office.

topic: Joseph Smith’s Teachings about Priesthood, Temple, and Women
question_text: Which statement best reflects Joseph Smith’s teaching about the Relief Society’s relationship to priesthood and the temple?
answers: He organized the Relief Society under priesthood authority and taught it would help prepare women to participate in temple ordinances, including the endowment
He organized the Relief Society as an independent church without priesthood oversight
He intended the Relief Society to replace priesthood quorums in governing the Church
He prohibited the Relief Society from any involvement related to the temple
correct_answer: He organized the Relief Society under priesthood authority and taught it would help prepare women to participate in temple ordinances, including the endowment
explanation: Joseph Smith organized the Female Relief Society of Nauvoo under priesthood authority and linked its purposes to preparing women for temple blessings and service, as noted in the Nauvoo Relief Society Minute Book and the Church’s Gospel Topics essay.

question_text: Which description best characterizes the Journal of Discourses?
answers: A 26-volume collection of sermons by early Latter-day Saint leaders published between 1854 and 1886
A single-volume scriptural appendix canonized by the Church in 1880
The official English-language magazine of the Church from 1897 to 1970
Minutes of the Nauvoo City Council compiled in 1842–1845
correct_answer: A 26-volume collection of sermons by early Latter-day Saint leaders published between 1854 and 1886
explanation: The Journal of Discourses comprises 26 volumes of sermons delivered by early Church leaders, printed 1854–1886.

question_text: What is the current doctrinal status of the Journal of Discourses in The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints?
answers: It is not scripture or an official source of doctrine; it is a historical resource of sermons
It is part of the standard works and binding on members
It is an official handbook superseding earlier policies
It is a modern Church magazine providing current doctrine
correct_answer: It is not scripture or an official source of doctrine; it is a historical resource of sermons
explanation: The Church identifies the Journal of Discourses as a historical publication and not an official or scriptural source of doctrine.

question_text: Who was the principal early stenographer whose shorthand notes formed the basis for many Journal of Discourses sermons?
answers: George D. Watt
B. H. Roberts
Orson Pratt
Joseph Fielding Smith
correct_answer: George D. Watt
explanation: George D. Watt reported many sermons in Pitman shorthand, which were later transcribed and published in the Journal of Discourses.

question_text: According to LDS scripture, to whom has the Father committed the role of final Judge of all humanity?
answers: Jesus Christ
Heavenly Father alone
The Twelve Apostles
Adam (Michael)
correct_answer: Jesus Christ
explanation: John 5:22 states the Father has committed all judgment to the Son, and 3 Nephi 27:27 affirms that Christ will judge all.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 137:9, on what basis will the Lord judge all people?
answers: Their works and the desires of their hearts
Works alone
Faith alone, regardless of works
Lineage and covenants made by ancestors
correct_answer: Their works and the desires of their hearts
explanation: D&C 137:9 explicitly states the Lord will judge all men according to their works and the desires of their hearts.

question_text: According to the Book of Mormon, when does the final judgment take place relative to the resurrection?
answers: After the resurrection
At the moment of death
Before the resurrection
Only during mortal life
correct_answer: After the resurrection
explanation: 2 Nephi 9:15 and Alma 11:43–44 teach that after the resurrection all will stand before the judgment seat of God.

question_text: Which statement best describes how justice and mercy are reconciled in LDS doctrine as taught in Alma 42?
answers: Through the Atonement of Jesus Christ, which satisfies the demands of justice while extending mercy to the penitent
Mercy simply overrides justice, eliminating the need for repentance
Justice is fulfilled by human obedience alone without the need of a Redeemer
Mercy is only available to those who never sin
correct_answer: Through the Atonement of Jesus Christ, which satisfies the demands of justice while extending mercy to the penitent
explanation: Alma 42 teaches that the Atonement of Christ satisfies justice and allows mercy to be extended on conditions of repentance.

question_text: Which statement reflects the LDS doctrine of justice regarding individual accountability?
answers: Men will be punished for their own sins, and not for Adam’s transgression
Children inherit guilt from Adam and Eve
Justice requires punishment for ancestral sins
Infants must be baptized to remove Adam’s sin
correct_answer: Men will be punished for their own sins, and not for Adam’s transgression
explanation: Article of Faith 2 affirms that each person is accountable for their own sins, not for Adam’s transgression.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 137:9, by what criteria will the Lord judge all people?
answers: According to their works and the desires of their hearts
According to lineage and tradition
According to public reputation and wealth
According to strict observance of ancient rituals
correct_answer: According to their works and the desires of their hearts
explanation: D&C 137:9 states that the Lord judges people by their works and the desires of their hearts, reflecting divine justice.

question_text: Which kingdom of glory is compared to the glory of the sun in Latter-day Saint scripture?
answers: Celestial kingdom
Terrestrial kingdom
Telestial kingdom
Outer darkness
correct_answer: Celestial kingdom
explanation: Paul speaks of differing glories (sun, moon, stars) in 1 Corinthians 15, and Doctrine and Covenants 76:70 identifies the celestial glory with the glory of the sun.

question_text: Which section of the Doctrine and Covenants contains “The Vision” that outlines the three degrees of glory?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 76
Doctrine and Covenants 132
Doctrine and Covenants 20
Doctrine and Covenants 138
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 76
explanation: D&C 76, received by Joseph Smith and Sidney Rigdon in 1832, details the celestial, terrestrial, and telestial kingdoms.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 76:86–88, through whose ministration do those in the telestial kingdom receive the Holy Spirit?
answers: Those of the terrestrial glory
Directly from the Father without any ministration
Those of the telestial glory themselves
Those of the celestial glory directly
correct_answer: Those of the terrestrial glory
explanation: D&C 76:86–88 teaches that the telestial receive of the Holy Spirit through the ministration of the terrestrial; the terrestrial receive through the ministration of the celestial.

question_text: Which ordinance in the Church is performed by the laying on of hands to confer the gift of the Holy Ghost after baptism?
answers: Baptism by immersion
Confirmation
Partaking of the sacrament
Receiving a temple recommend
correct_answer: Confirmation
explanation: The gift of the Holy Ghost is bestowed by the laying on of hands in the ordinance of confirmation (see D&C 20:41; Moroni 2:2; Acts 8:14–17).

question_text: Which of the following is NOT administered by the laying on of hands in the Church?
answers: Confirmation as a member of the Church
Ordination to a priesthood office
Baptism for the remission of sins
Setting apart to a calling
correct_answer: Baptism for the remission of sins
explanation: Baptism is performed by immersion in water (D&C 20:73–74); the others are performed by laying on of hands with proper authority.

question_text: According to the New Testament, by what means did Peter and John bestow the Holy Ghost upon baptized believers in Samaria?
answers: By the laying on of hands
By sprinkling with water
By casting lots
By the washing of feet
correct_answer: By the laying on of hands
explanation: Acts 8:14–17 records that Peter and John laid their hands on the believers, and they received the Holy Ghost.

question_text: According to LDS scripture, who receives the Light (Spirit) of Christ?
answers: Every person born into the world
Only those baptized and confirmed members of the Church
Only prophets and apostles
Only those in the house of Israel
correct_answer: Every person born into the world
explanation: Scripture teaches that the Spirit/Light of Christ "lighteth every man" and is "given to every man" to help discern good from evil (John 1:9; Moroni 7:16; D&C 84:46).

question_text: Which statement correctly distinguishes the Light of Christ from the Holy Ghost in LDS doctrine?
answers: The Light of Christ is an influence given to all people; the Holy Ghost is a member of the Godhead whose gift is received by the laying on of hands after baptism.
Both the Light of Christ and the Holy Ghost are personages of spirit who indwell only Church members.
The Light of Christ and the Holy Ghost are the same being with different titles.
The Light of Christ is received only in temples, whereas the Holy Ghost is innate in all people.
correct_answer: The Light of Christ is an influence given to all people; the Holy Ghost is a member of the Godhead whose gift is received by the laying on of hands after baptism.
explanation: D&C 88:11–13 describes the Light of Christ as divine light/influence in all creation; D&C 130:22 identifies the Holy Ghost as a personage of spirit; D&C 20:41 and Acts 8:17 teach the gift of the Holy Ghost is conferred by laying on of hands after baptism.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 88:6–13, which description accurately reflects the Light of Christ?
answers: It proceeds from the presence of God to fill the immensity of space and gives life to all things.
It is limited to the earth and ceases at physical death.
It is synonymous with priesthood authority to perform ordinances.
It is a temporary influence that is replaced by the Holy Ghost at baptism.
correct_answer: It proceeds from the presence of God to fill the immensity of space and gives life to all things.
explanation: D&C 88:12–13 teaches that the light which proceeds from God's presence fills the immensity of space, gives life to all things, and is the law by which all things are governed—descriptions of the Light of Christ.

question_text: According to the Book of Mormon (Moroni 7:47), how is "charity" defined?
answers: The pure love of Christ
Sincere affection toward family members
Strict adherence to ordinances
Philanthropic donations to the poor
correct_answer: The pure love of Christ
explanation: Moroni 7:47 states that charity is "the pure love of Christ" and that it endures forever.

question_text: Which of the following is explicitly included in the baptismal covenant described in Mosiah 18:8–10, expressing Christlike love?
answers: To mourn with those that mourn, and comfort those that stand in need of comfort
To pay tithing on all income each month
To serve a full-time mission
To attend the temple every week
correct_answer: To mourn with those that mourn, and comfort those that stand in need of comfort
explanation: Mosiah 18:8–10 teaches that those entering the covenant are willing to mourn with those that mourn and comfort those who need comfort.

question_text: In the King James Version of 1 Corinthians 13, the word "charity" translates which Greek term for love?
answers: Agape
Phileo
Eros
Storge
correct_answer: Agape
explanation: In 1 Corinthians 13, the KJV renders the Greek agapē as "charity," referring to the highest form of selfless love.

question_text: According to The Family: A Proclamation to the World, what is the Church’s doctrinal teaching about marriage?
answers: Marriage between a man and a woman is ordained of God and essential to His eternal plan
Marriage is a temporary civil contract with no eternal significance
Marriage should be avoided to focus on personal salvation
Marriage is only appropriate for clergy
correct_answer: Marriage between a man and a woman is ordained of God and essential to His eternal plan
explanation: The Proclamation states that marriage between a man and a woman is ordained of God and central to His plan for His children; D&C 49:15 also affirms that marriage is ordained of God.

question_text: For a couple to be sealed (married) in an LDS temple, what is required of them?
answers: Each must hold a current temple recommend and meet worthiness standards
At least one must be a returned missionary
They must be civilly married for one year before a sealing can occur worldwide
Both must be endowed long before the sealing; endowments cannot be received the same day
correct_answer: Each must hold a current temple recommend and meet worthiness standards
explanation: Living sealings are performed by priesthood authority in temples and require each participant to have a current temple recommend and be worthy; prior endowment and a one-year civil wait are not universally required under current policy.

question_text: Which document officially announced the end of the practice of plural marriage in the LDS Church?
answers: Official Declaration 1 (1890)
Official Declaration 2 (1978)
The Articles of Faith (1842)
The King Follett Discourse (1844)
correct_answer: Official Declaration 1 (1890)
explanation: Official Declaration 1, included in the Doctrine and Covenants, announced in 1890 that the Church would cease contracting new plural marriages in compliance with the law.

question_text: According to the Church’s official style guide for media, what is the correct full name that should be used on first reference in news coverage?
answers: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
The Mormon Church
The LDS Church
The Church of Latter-day Saints
correct_answer: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
explanation: The Church requests that media use the full name, “The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints,” on first reference; nicknames such as “Mormon Church” or “LDS Church” are not authorized.

question_text: Which magazine replaced the New Era as the Church’s official publication for youth beginning January 2021?
answers: For the Strength of Youth (FSY)
Ensign
Liahona
BYU Studies Quarterly
correct_answer: For the Strength of Youth (FSY)
explanation: As part of the 2021 magazine realignment, the New Era was replaced by For the Strength of Youth for youth, the Liahona became the magazine for adults worldwide, and the Friend continued for children.

question_text: According to For the Strength of Youth: A Guide for Making Choices (2022), how should Latter-day Saints approach media rating systems when choosing entertainment?
answers: Do not rely solely on ratings; use gospel principles and the Holy Ghost to guide choices
Rely on national ratings because they reflect Church standards
Only watch media rated PG or lower
Avoid all media produced outside official Church channels
correct_answer: Do not rely solely on ratings; use gospel principles and the Holy Ghost to guide choices
explanation: FSY 2022 teaches principle-based decision-making: rather than depending on ratings, members should choose media that invites the Spirit and aligns with gospel standards.

question_text: Which of the following is an office in the Melchizedek Priesthood, as listed in Doctrine and Covenants 107?
answers: Elder
Priest
Deacon
Bishop
correct_answer: Elder
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 107 identifies elder as an office in the Melchizedek Priesthood. Deacon and priest are offices in the Aaronic Priesthood, and bishop presides over the Aaronic Priesthood.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 107:18–19, which statement correctly describes a key or privilege of the Melchizedek Priesthood?
answers: It holds the keys of all the spiritual blessings of the Church.
It holds the keys of the ministering of angels and of baptism by immersion for the remission of sins.
It directs only the temporal affairs of the Church and has no authority in spiritual matters.
It grants exclusive authority to preside over all wards regardless of calling.
correct_answer: It holds the keys of all the spiritual blessings of the Church.
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 107:18–19 teaches that the Melchizedek Priesthood holds the keys of all the spiritual blessings of the Church. The ministering of angels and baptismal authority are associated with the Aaronic Priesthood (D&C 13).

question_text: Why is the 'Holy Priesthood after the Order of the Son of God' called the Melchizedek Priesthood?
answers: To avoid too frequent repetition of the name of the Son of God.
Because Melchizedek restored the priesthood to Joseph Smith in 1829.
Because it originated in the city of Salem and thus bears Melchizedek’s civic title.
To distinguish it from the Levitical Priesthood introduced by John the Baptist.
correct_answer: To avoid too frequent repetition of the name of the Son of God.
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 107:2–4 states that the name Melchizedek Priesthood was adopted to avoid too frequent use of the name of the Son of God.

question_text: What term did The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints adopt in 2019 to replace 'disciplinary council'?
answers: Membership council
Fellowship council
Church court
Repentance panel
correct_answer: Membership council
explanation: In 2019, the Church updated the General Handbook and replaced 'disciplinary council' with 'membership council' to emphasize the purposes of protection, repentance, and Church integrity.

question_text: Which of the following is NOT a possible outcome of a Church membership council?
answers: No action
Formal membership restrictions
Withdrawal of membership
A monetary fine imposed by the Church
correct_answer: A monetary fine imposed by the Church
explanation: According to the General Handbook, possible outcomes are 'no action,' 'formal membership restrictions,' or 'withdrawal of membership.' The Church does not impose monetary fines.

question_text: In a ward membership council, who presides and makes the final decision after counseling with his counselors?
answers: The bishop
The stake president
The high council by majority vote
The Relief Society president
correct_answer: The bishop
explanation: The General Handbook states that the bishop presides over a ward membership council and, after prayerful deliberation with his counselors, makes the final decision.

question_text: According to Alma 42 in the Book of Mormon, whom does mercy "claim" while justice claims the unrepentant?
answers: The penitent (those who repent)
Those who have never sinned
All people regardless of repentance
Only those under the Law of Moses
correct_answer: The penitent (those who repent)
explanation: Alma teaches that "mercy claimeth the penitent" while justice claims the unrepentant (Alma 42:23–24).

question_text: In Doctrine and Covenants 64:10, what does the Lord require of His disciples regarding forgiveness?
answers: Forgive all people
Forgive only those who ask for forgiveness
Withhold forgiveness until full restitution is made
Leave forgiveness decisions to Church leaders
correct_answer: Forgive all people
explanation: The Lord says, "I, the Lord, will forgive whom I will forgive, but of you it is required to forgive all men" (D&C 64:10).

question_text: In 3 Nephi 12:7 (the Savior’s Beatitudes in the Book of Mormon), what blessing is promised to the merciful?
answers: They shall obtain mercy
They shall inherit the earth
They shall be called the children of God
They shall see God
correct_answer: They shall obtain mercy
explanation: The Beatitude states: "Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy" (3 Nephi 12:7; cf. Matthew 5:7).

question_text: According to Latter-day Saint scripture, what happens to Satan during the Millennium?
answers: He is bound and cannot tempt people for a thousand years
He continues to tempt but with reduced power
He is destroyed permanently and ceases to exist
He rules over the wicked on earth during that time
correct_answer: He is bound and cannot tempt people for a thousand years
explanation: Revelation 20:2–3 and Doctrine and Covenants 43:31 teach that Satan will be bound during the thousand years of the Millennium.

question_text: Which Article of Faith explicitly teaches that Christ will reign personally upon the earth and that the earth will be renewed and receive its paradisiacal glory?
answers: Article of Faith 10
Article of Faith 4
Article of Faith 12
Article of Faith 13
correct_answer: Article of Faith 10
explanation: Article of Faith 10 states that Christ will reign personally on the earth and that the earth will be renewed and receive its paradisiacal glory.

question_text: According to Revelation 20, when are those who did not participate in the First Resurrection raised from the dead relative to the Millennium?
answers: After the thousand years are finished
At the start of the Millennium
In the middle of the Millennium
Before Christ’s Second Coming
correct_answer: After the thousand years are finished
explanation: Revelation 20:5 teaches that “the rest of the dead lived not again until the thousand years were finished,” aligning with Latter-day Saint teachings on the order of resurrections.

question_text: Which program, announced in April 2018 general conference, replaced home teaching and visiting teaching in the Church?
answers: Ministering
Come, Follow Me
Self-Reliance Services
Ward Mission Plan
correct_answer: Ministering
explanation: In April 2018 general conference, Church leaders introduced ministering as a holier approach to caring, replacing home and visiting teaching.

question_text: In a ward, who directs ministering and extends ministering assignments to adult members?
answers: Elders quorum and Relief Society presidencies under the bishop's direction
The bishop alone
The stake presidency
The ward mission leader
correct_answer: Elders quorum and Relief Society presidencies under the bishop's direction
explanation: The General Handbook states that elders quorum and Relief Society presidencies lead ministering in the ward and make assignments, under the bishop’s direction.

question_text: According to the General Handbook, how often should elders quorum and Relief Society presidencies hold ministering interviews at a minimum?
answers: At least quarterly
Weekly
Annually
Only as requested by the bishop
correct_answer: At least quarterly
explanation: The General Handbook specifies that ministering interviews are held regularly, at least quarterly.

question_text: According to Moroni 7 in the Book of Mormon, what causes miracles to cease among the children of men?
answers: Unbelief among the people
The completion of the New Testament
The loss of the Ark of the Covenant
The absence of temples on the earth
correct_answer: Unbelief among the people
explanation: Moroni 7:37–38 teaches that miracles are wrought by faith and cease because of unbelief.

question_text: Which section of the Doctrine and Covenants records the appearance of the Lord Jesus Christ in the Kirtland Temple to Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 110
Doctrine and Covenants 20
Doctrine and Covenants 121
Doctrine and Covenants 76
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 110
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 110 recounts the April 3, 1836 manifestation of the Lord in the Kirtland Temple.

question_text: In LDS scripture, where is "the working of miracles" identified as a gift of the Spirit?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 46
Doctrine and Covenants 89
Articles of Faith 13
Moses 1
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 46
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 46:19–21 lists gifts of the Spirit, including the working of miracles.

question_text: According to Preach My Gospel, what is the stated purpose of a full-time missionary?
answers: Invite others to come unto Christ by helping them receive the restored gospel through faith in Jesus Christ and His Atonement, repentance, baptism, receiving the gift of the Holy Ghost, and enduring to the end
Build local Church membership by increasing attendance at Sunday meetings
Teach comparative religion and interfaith understanding in communities
Provide humanitarian aid without sharing religious messages
correct_answer: Invite others to come unto Christ by helping them receive the restored gospel through faith in Jesus Christ and His Atonement, repentance, baptism, receiving the gift of the Holy Ghost, and enduring to the end
explanation: Preach My Gospel states this exact purpose in chapter 1.

question_text: Which section of the Doctrine and Covenants outlines qualifications for missionary service and begins, "Now behold, a marvelous work is about to come forth among the children of men"?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 4
Doctrine and Covenants 20
Doctrine and Covenants 76
Doctrine and Covenants 89
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 4
explanation: D&C 4 is a foundational missionary scripture emphasizing desire, faith, and other qualifications.

question_text: In the LDS Church, who extends the formal call to serve as a full-time missionary?
answers: The President of the Church
The stake president
The mission president
The Quorum of the Seventy
correct_answer: The President of the Church
explanation: The formal call letter is issued by and in the name of the President of the Church.

question_text: Which current official Church publication gives principle-based guidance on modesty and dress for youth?
answers: For the Strength of Youth: A Guide for Making Choices (2022)
Handbook 1: Stake Presidents and Bishops (2010)
Gospel Topics Essays: Modesty
The Family: A Proclamation to the World (1995)
correct_answer: For the Strength of Youth: A Guide for Making Choices (2022)
explanation: The 2022 For the Strength of Youth guide provides principle-based standards on dress and appearance, including modesty.

question_text: According to official Latter-day Saint teachings, what is a primary doctrinal reason for modest dress and appearance?
answers: The body is sacred—a temple of God—and should be treated with respect
To signal social status within the community
To conform to prevailing cultural fashions
To earn salvation by clothing choices alone
correct_answer: The body is sacred—a temple of God—and should be treated with respect
explanation: Scripture teaches that the body is a temple (1 Corinthians 6:19–20), and official guidance (FSY) emphasizes respecting the body as sacred.

question_text: Which statement reflects the Church’s official policy on temple garments and modesty in clothing choices?
answers: Endowed members wear the garment day and night as a sacred reminder of covenants and choose clothing that properly covers it
Temple garments are required only during Sunday meetings
Members should alter the garment to match current fashion trends
Garments are intended to be displayed publicly as a sign of faith
correct_answer: Endowed members wear the garment day and night as a sacred reminder of covenants and choose clothing that properly covers it
explanation: The General Handbook teaches that the garment is sacred, worn day and night, and members should not adjust garments or clothing to fit styles that do not properly cover the garment (see General Handbook 38.5.5).

question_text: According to the Church's official style guide, what is the preferred full name of the faith often nicknamed the "Mormon Church"?
answers: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
The Church of Latter-day Saints
The Church of Jesus Christ of LDS
The Mormon Church
correct_answer: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
explanation: The Church requests use of its revealed name and discourages nicknames like "Mormon Church," per its official Newsroom style guide.

question_text: According to Latter-day Saint scripture, who conferred the Aaronic Priesthood upon Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery in 1829?
answers: John the Baptist
Peter, James, and John
Moroni
Elias
correct_answer: John the Baptist
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 13 and Joseph Smith—History 1:68–72 state that John the Baptist conferred the Aaronic Priesthood.

question_text: On what date was The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints officially organized?
answers: April 6, 1830
March 27, 1836
correct_answer: April 6, 1830
explanation: The Church was organized on April 6, 1830, in Fayette, New York, as recorded in official Church history.

question_text: According to its official subtitle, how is the Book of Mormon described?
answers: Another Testament of Jesus Christ
A History of Ancient America
A Companion to the Holy Bible
The Everlasting Gospel Restored
correct_answer: Another Testament of Jesus Christ
explanation: Since 1982, the Book of Mormon’s subtitle reads “Another Testament of Jesus Christ,” as printed on official editions by the Church.

question_text: In what year was The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints formally organized?
explanation: The Church was organized on April 6, 1830, as documented in Doctrine and Covenants 20:1 and official Church histories.

question_text: After a temple is dedicated, who may enter to participate in ordinances in temples of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints?
answers: Anyone who wishes to visit
Only baptized members of any Christian faith
Only members with a current temple recommend
Only Melchizedek Priesthood holders
correct_answer: Only members with a current temple recommend
explanation: Post-dedication, entrance is limited to Latter-day Saints in good standing who hold a valid temple recommend, per the General Handbook and official policy.

question_text: According to official Church guidance, what is the preferred way to refer to the faith often nicknamed "Mormons"?
answers: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
The Mormon Church
The LDS Church
The Church of Latter-day Saints
correct_answer: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
explanation: Official guidance from the Church requests use of the full, proper name rather than nicknames like "Mormon Church" or "LDS Church."

question_text: In Latter-day Saint scripture, who is "Mormon," from whom the nickname "Mormons" derives?
answers: A prophet-historian who abridged the Nephite record into the Book of Mormon
A 19th-century American evangelist who joined Joseph Smith
A city in ancient Jerusalem mentioned in the Bible
Another name for Jesus Christ used by early Christians
correct_answer: A prophet-historian who abridged the Nephite record into the Book of Mormon
explanation: The Book of Mormon is named after the prophet Mormon, who compiled and abridged the record.

question_text: Which statement reflects the Church’s official position about whether "Mormons" are Christians?
answers: Members are Christians who believe in Jesus Christ as the Savior and Redeemer and strive to follow His teachings
Members are not Christians because they reject the Bible
Members are Christians only culturally, not doctrinally
Members are a non-Christian sect that does not believe in Jesus Christ
correct_answer: Members are Christians who believe in Jesus Christ as the Savior and Redeemer and strive to follow His teachings
explanation: The Church affirms it is a Christian church centered on Jesus Christ and accepts both the Bible and the Book of Mormon as scripture.

question_text: According to LDS scripture, what is a central purpose of mortality in the plan of salvation?
answers: To obtain a physical body and be proved through choices
To permanently escape God's presence
To become immortal and resurrected immediately
To remember all premortal knowledge without a veil
correct_answer: To obtain a physical body and be proved through choices
explanation: LDS scripture teaches that mortality is a probationary state to gain a body and be tested (Abraham 3:25; Alma 12:24; 2 Nephi 2:27).

question_text: In Latter-day Saint teachings, which event introduced physical death and mortality into the world?
answers: The Fall of Adam and Eve
The Great Flood in Noah's day
The Tower of Babel
The Crucifixion of Jesus Christ
correct_answer: The Fall of Adam and Eve
explanation: LDS scriptures state that death entered the world through the Fall (2 Nephi 2:22; Moses 6:48; Alma 12:23-24).

question_text: What does LDS scripture teach happens to the spirit at physical death before resurrection?
answers: It sleeps unconscious until the Final Judgment
It immediately receives a resurrected body of glory
It enters the spirit world (paradise or prison) to await resurrection
It ceases to exist until the Millennium
correct_answer: It enters the spirit world (paradise or prison) to await resurrection
explanation: Alma 40:11-14 and Doctrine and Covenants 138 teach that spirits go to the spirit world—paradise or prison—to await the resurrection.

question_text: Which official Church document explicitly teaches that all people are beloved spirit sons and daughters of Heavenly Parents?
answers: The Family: A Proclamation to the World (1995)
The Articles of Faith
Official Declaration 2
The Living Christ: The Testimony of the Apostles
correct_answer: The Family: A Proclamation to the World (1995)
explanation: The Proclamation states that all human beings are beloved spirit sons or daughters of heavenly parents, affirming the doctrine of Heavenly Parents.

question_text: According to official Church teachings, how should Latter-day Saints address their prayers with respect to Heavenly Mother?
answers: To Heavenly Father in the name of Jesus Christ; Latter-day Saints do not pray to Heavenly Mother
To Heavenly Mother and Heavenly Father interchangeably
Only to Jesus Christ
The Church gives no guidance on this matter
correct_answer: To Heavenly Father in the name of Jesus Christ; Latter-day Saints do not pray to Heavenly Mother
explanation: Official guidance teaches that prayers are addressed to Heavenly Father in the name of Jesus Christ; the Gospel Topics essay on 'Mother in Heaven' reiterates this practice.

question_text: Which statement best reflects the LDS Church’s official doctrine regarding a Mother in Heaven?
answers: A belief in a Heavenly Mother, the eternal companion of Heavenly Father, is affirmed by Church leaders, though revealed details are limited
She is a metaphorical figure and not an actual being
Her name and attributes are revealed in canonized scripture
Members are encouraged to publicly speculate about her nature and offer worship to her
correct_answer: A belief in a Heavenly Mother, the eternal companion of Heavenly Father, is affirmed by Church leaders, though revealed details are limited
explanation: Official sources affirm the existence of Heavenly Parents and a Mother in Heaven while noting that specific revealed details are limited and speculation is discouraged.

question_text: On what date did the Mountain Meadows Massacre occur in southern Utah Territory?
answers: September 11, 1857
September 17, 1856
October 5, 1859
correct_answer: September 11, 1857
explanation: The massacre culminated on September 11, 1857, at Mountain Meadows in southern Utah Territory.

question_text: What was the emigrant group targeted in the Mountain Meadows Massacre commonly known as?
answers: The Baker–Fancher party
The Donner–Reed party
The Martin Handcart Company
A Pony Express caravan
correct_answer: The Baker–Fancher party
explanation: The victims were primarily from an Arkansas-based emigrant wagon train commonly called the Baker–Fancher party.

question_text: Who was the only individual convicted and executed for involvement in the Mountain Meadows Massacre?
answers: John D. Lee
Brigham Young
George A. Smith
Isaac C. Haight
correct_answer: John D. Lee
explanation: John D. Lee was convicted in 1876 and executed by firing squad in 1877 at Mountain Meadows; he was the only person convicted in connection with the massacre.

question_text: According to the 2022 For the Strength of Youth: A Guide for Making Choices, which principle should guide Latter-day Saints’ choices about movies, television, and other media?
answers: Choose media that uplifts, inspires, and invites the Spirit.
Avoid only media with an R rating.
Follow the media preferences of local leaders.
Watch what is most popular to stay culturally relevant.
correct_answer: Choose media that uplifts, inspires, and invites the Spirit.
explanation: The FSY guide teaches to use gospel principles and the Holy Ghost to choose media that draws you closer to Heavenly Father, not to rely on external rating systems.

question_text: Which organization produces and publishes the Book of Mormon Videos series available on ChurchofJesusChrist.org and official Church YouTube channels?
answers: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
BYUtv
Deseret Book
An independent nonprofit foundation
correct_answer: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
explanation: The Book of Mormon Videos are an official production of the Church and are released on its website and official YouTube channels.

question_text: Which statement accurately describes how the Church makes general conference available to members worldwide?
answers: It is broadcast semiannually via satellite, internet streaming, radio, and television in many languages.
It is only available to those attending in person at the Conference Center in Salt Lake City.
It airs annually on television in English only.
It is distributed exclusively on commercial movie streaming services.
correct_answer: It is broadcast semiannually via satellite, internet streaming, radio, and television in many languages.
explanation: General conference is held twice a year and is broadcast globally through multiple media channels in numerous languages.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 25:12, how does the Lord describe "the song of the righteous"?
answers: It is a prayer unto Him.
It is less pleasing than spoken prayer.
It is intended only for private worship.
It is forbidden during the Sabbath.
correct_answer: It is a prayer unto Him.
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 25:12 states that "the song of the righteous is a prayer unto me," affirming the spiritual value of sacred music.

question_text: According to the General Handbook, what type of hymn is to be sung immediately before the sacrament is blessed and passed in sacrament meeting?
answers: A sacrament hymn
Any hymn chosen by the chorister
A missionary hymn
A patriotic hymn
correct_answer: A sacrament hymn
explanation: The General Handbook instructs that a sacrament hymn is sung before the ordinance of the sacrament is administered in sacrament meeting.

question_text: In what year did the Tabernacle Choir at Temple Square begin its weekly broadcast Music and the Spoken Word?
explanation: Music and the Spoken Word first aired in 1929 and has continued as a weekly broadcast since then.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 130:20–21, what principle governs the reception of God's blessings?
answers: Blessings come by obedience to the law upon which they are predicated
Blessings are given randomly to teach humility
Blessings depend primarily on priesthood lineage
Blessings come solely through prayer, regardless of actions
correct_answer: Blessings come by obedience to the law upon which they are predicated
explanation: D&C 130:20–21 teaches that all blessings are predicated upon obedience to specific laws decreed before the world was.

question_text: In John 14:15, Jesus teaches that love for Him is shown by what action?
answers: Keeping His commandments
Performing public almsgiving
Fasting twice a week
Seeking signs and wonders
correct_answer: Keeping His commandments
explanation: John 14:15 states, "If ye love me, keep my commandments," linking love for the Savior with obedience.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 58:26–27, how should disciples approach obedience in their daily efforts?
answers: Be anxiously engaged in a good cause and do many things of their own free will
Wait to be commanded in all things before acting
Avoid acting without explicit, direct revelation
Let leaders make all righteous decisions for them
correct_answer: Be anxiously engaged in a good cause and do many things of their own free will
explanation: D&C 58:26–27 counsels that it is not meet to be commanded in all things and encourages proactive, willing obedience.

topic: The Only True and Living Church
question_text: In which scripture passage is the phrase "the only true and living church upon the face of the whole earth" found?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 1:30
Doctrine and Covenants 20:1
Articles of Faith 1:1
Book of Mormon, 3 Nephi 27:8
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 1:30
explanation: The exact phrase appears in Doctrine and Covenants 1:30, part of the Lord’s preface to the book.

topic: The Only True and Living Church
question_text: Who is the speaker declaring the Church to be "the only true and living church" in Doctrine and Covenants 1:30?
answers: The Lord Jesus Christ
Joseph Smith
Moroni
The Twelve Apostles
correct_answer: The Lord Jesus Christ
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 1 is the Lord’s preface; the verse reads, "I, the Lord," identifying Jesus Christ as the speaker.

topic: The Only True and Living Church
question_text: In Doctrine and Covenants 1:30, what clarification does the Lord add after calling the Church "the only true and living church"?
answers: That He is "speaking unto the church collectively and not individually"
That the Church would never face opposition or persecution
That Zion had already been fully redeemed
That all other churches are entirely without truth
correct_answer: That He is "speaking unto the church collectively and not individually"
explanation: D&C 1:30 states the Lord is well pleased, "speaking unto the church collectively and not individually," clarifying the scope of His statement.

question_text: Which of the following is a saving ordinance required for exaltation in Latter-day Saint doctrine?
answers: Baptism by immersion for the remission of sins
Naming and blessing of children
Patriarchal blessing
Setting apart for a calling
correct_answer: Baptism by immersion for the remission of sins
explanation: Saving ordinances include baptism, confirmation (gift of the Holy Ghost), Melchizedek Priesthood ordination for men, temple endowment, and temple sealing. Baptism is explicitly required (see 2 Nephi 31; Doctrine and Covenants 20; General Handbook).

question_text: Which revelation authorizes the use of water instead of wine for the sacrament in Latter-day Saint practice?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 27
Doctrine and Covenants 89
Moroni 6
Articles of Faith 13
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 27
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 27:2 states that it does not matter what is eaten or drunk in the sacrament, authorizing the use of water in modern practice.

question_text: Where must baptisms for the dead be performed according to Latter-day Saint scripture and practice?
answers: In a temple’s baptismal font
In any body of water with a bishop’s approval
In a meetinghouse font
At home with family present
correct_answer: In a temple’s baptismal font
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 124:29–33 directs that baptisms for the dead be performed in the house of the Lord (the temple) in a baptismal font.

question_text: In Latter-day Saint scripture, what is the state or place where righteous spirits go between death and resurrection called?
answers: Paradise
Celestial kingdom
Spirit prison
Outer darkness
correct_answer: Paradise
explanation: Alma 40:12 describes a 'state of happiness, which is called paradise' for the righteous between death and resurrection.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 138, to whom did Jesus Christ appear in the spirit world following His death?
answers: The spirits of the righteous in Paradise
The wicked spirits in spirit prison
All spirits, both righteous and wicked, personally
No spirits; He remained in the tomb until the Resurrection
correct_answer: The spirits of the righteous in Paradise
explanation: D&C 138:18–20 records that the Savior appeared to the spirits of the righteous; verses 29–31 explain He organized the preaching to those in spirit prison rather than visiting them personally.

question_text: Which New Testament verse records Jesus saying to the penitent thief, 'Today shalt thou be with me in paradise'?
answers: Luke 23:43
John 3:5
Acts 2:38
2 Corinthians 12:4
correct_answer: Luke 23:43
explanation: Luke 23:43 (KJV) contains Jesus’s promise to the thief that he would be with Him in paradise.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 68:25–28, which responsibility is specifically commanded to parents regarding their children?
answers: Teach their children to pray and to walk uprightly before the Lord, and have them baptized when they are eight years old
Ensure their children serve full-time missions at age 18
Ordain their sons to the priesthood at age 12 regardless of worthiness
Homeschool their children in gospel subjects
correct_answer: Teach their children to pray and to walk uprightly before the Lord, and have them baptized when they are eight years old
explanation: D&C 68:25–28 commands parents to teach children to understand the doctrine of repentance and faith in Christ, to be baptized at eight, and to pray and walk uprightly.

question_text: According to “The Family: A Proclamation to the World,” what primary responsibilities are assigned to fathers and mothers?
answers: Fathers are to preside, provide, and protect; mothers are primarily responsible for the nurture of their children
Fathers handle spiritual matters while mothers handle temporal finances
Both parents have identical assigned roles without distinction
Fathers are primarily responsible for nurturing while mothers preside and provide
correct_answer: Fathers are to preside, provide, and protect; mothers are primarily responsible for the nurture of their children
explanation: The Proclamation states that fathers preside over, provide for, and protect their families, and that mothers are primarily responsible for the nurture of their children, working together as equal partners.

question_text: According to the Church’s General Handbook, which evening is generally reserved for family home evening with no regular Church meetings scheduled?
answers: Monday
Wednesday
Friday
Sunday
correct_answer: Monday
explanation: The General Handbook designates Monday evening for family home evening and encourages Church units to avoid scheduling meetings then.

question_text: In Latter-day Saint belief and organization, the office of "patriarch" belongs to which priesthood?
answers: The Melchizedek Priesthood
The Aaronic Priesthood
No priesthood; it is a lay assignment only
The Levitical Priesthood
correct_answer: The Melchizedek Priesthood
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 107 identifies patriarchs (called evangelical ministers) as an office in the Melchizedek Priesthood.

question_text: According to Church policy, who issues the recommend for a member to receive a patriarchal blessing?
answers: The bishop
The stake president
The patriarch
Any Melchizedek Priesthood holder
correct_answer: The bishop
explanation: The General Handbook states that members counsel with their bishop, who interviews them and issues the recommend for a patriarchal blessing.

question_text: Who was the last person to serve as Patriarch to the Church before the office ceased to be filled?
answers: Eldred G. Smith
Hyrum G. Smith
Joseph Fielding Smith
William Smith
correct_answer: Eldred G. Smith
explanation: Eldred G. Smith served as Patriarch to the Church until he was given emeritus status in 1979; the office has not been filled since.

question_text: According to official Church policy, who is authorized to pronounce patriarchal blessings?
answers: An ordained stake patriarch
Any Melchizedek Priesthood holder with a current temple recommend
A bishop or branch president
A mission president
correct_answer: An ordained stake patriarch
explanation: Patriarchal blessings are given by an ordained patriarch (stake patriarch) as outlined in official Church policy and teachings.

question_text: In a patriarchal blessing, what does the declaration of lineage generally signify?
answers: The recipient’s relationship to the house of Israel, either as a literal descendant or by adoption
A certified genealogical proof of specific ancestors
A permanent tribal assignment that determines Church callings
A legal entitlement to a portion of modern land in the Middle East
correct_answer: The recipient’s relationship to the house of Israel, either as a literal descendant or by adoption
explanation: Lineage in patriarchal blessings identifies connection to the house of Israel; it is not a genealogical certification nor does it determine callings or legal land claims.

question_text: Which statement correctly describes how patriarchal blessings are handled after they are given?
answers: They are recorded, transcribed, and archived by the Church; recipients receive a copy
Recipients may not have a written copy of their blessing
They are never recorded or preserved
Posting them publicly online is encouraged by the Church
correct_answer: They are recorded, transcribed, and archived by the Church; recipients receive a copy
explanation: The Church records and archives patriarchal blessings and provides recipients with a copy; additional copies can be requested.

question_text: Which scripture passage contains Jesus' statement, "Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you"?
answers: John 14:27
Matthew 5:9
Doctrine and Covenants 59:23
Alma 7:27
correct_answer: John 14:27
explanation: In the King James Version, John 14:27 records Jesus saying, "Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you."

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 59:23, what promise is given to those who do "the works of righteousness"?
answers: Peace in this world, and eternal life in the world to come
Riches and honor before all men
Power to perform all miracles
Protection from all trials and tribulations
correct_answer: Peace in this world, and eternal life in the world to come
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 59:23 states that those who do the works of righteousness will receive "peace in this world, and eternal life in the world to come."

question_text: In the Beatitudes (Matthew 5:9; 3 Nephi 12:9), what is promised to peacemakers?
answers: They shall be called the children of God
They shall inherit the earth
They shall obtain mercy
They shall see God
correct_answer: They shall be called the children of God
explanation: Both Matthew 5:9 and 3 Nephi 12:9 declare, "Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God."

topic: Peace and Violence among 19th-Century Latter-day Saints
question_text: Which Latter-day Saint scripture, received in 1833, teaches the 'law of forgiveness' (forgiving repeated offenses) and delineates when defensive action or war may be justified?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 98
Doctrine and Covenants 89
Pearl of Great Price, Moses 7
Articles of Faith 11
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 98
explanation: D&C 98:23–48 (August 1833) instructs the Saints to forgive multiple times and outlines circumstances under which defensive warfare may be justified.

topic: Peace and Violence among 19th-Century Latter-day Saints
question_text: In October 1838, Missouri Governor Lilburn W. Boggs issued Executive Order 44 regarding Latter-day Saints. Which description is accurate?
answers: It declared that Mormons must be exterminated or driven from the state.
It granted Latter-day Saints full legal protections and restitution.
It called for a truce and the return of confiscated arms to church members.
It authorized the creation of a Mormon county with self-governance.
correct_answer: It declared that Mormons must be exterminated or driven from the state.
explanation: Executive Order 44 ordered that Mormons be 'exterminated or driven from the State'; it was officially rescinded in 1976.

topic: Peace and Violence among 19th-Century Latter-day Saints
question_text: The 1857–1858 Utah War between the U.S. government and Latter-day Saints is best characterized by which statement?
answers: A largely bloodless confrontation resolved by negotiation and a presidential pardon.
A prolonged civil war with thousands of casualties on both sides.
A naval blockade of the Great Salt Lake with no land operations.
An invasion by a foreign power allied with the Saints.
correct_answer: A largely bloodless confrontation resolved by negotiation and a presidential pardon.
explanation: Often called 'Buchanan’s Blunder,' the conflict involved the Utah Expedition and ended after peace commissioners negotiated and President Buchanan issued a general pardon.

question_text: Which of the following is NOT part of the Pearl of Great Price?
answers: Book of Moses
Joseph Smith—History
Book of Abraham
The Acts of the Apostles
correct_answer: The Acts of the Apostles
explanation: The Pearl of Great Price includes the Book of Moses, Book of Abraham, Joseph Smith—Matthew, Joseph Smith—History, and the Articles of Faith; Acts is a New Testament book and not included.

question_text: In what year did the Church officially canonize the Pearl of Great Price as scripture?
explanation: The Pearl of Great Price was presented and accepted as scripture by vote of the Church in October 1880.

question_text: Joseph Smith—Matthew in the Pearl of Great Price is an extract from Joseph Smith’s translation of which New Testament chapter?
answers: Matthew 24
Mark 13
Luke 21
John 14
correct_answer: Matthew 24
explanation: Joseph Smith—Matthew is an extract from the Joseph Smith Translation of Matthew 24, the Savior’s Olivet Discourse.

question_text: According to Latter-day Saint scripture, which verse states God's purpose as "to bring to pass the immortality and eternal life of man"?
answers: Moses 1:39
Doctrine and Covenants 1:30
Alma 32:21
John 17:3
correct_answer: Moses 1:39
explanation: Moses 1:39 explicitly declares God's work and glory, a central summary of the Plan of Salvation.

question_text: Which three degrees of glory are described in Doctrine and Covenants section 76?
answers: Celestial, Terrestrial, and Telestial kingdoms
Celestial, Terrestrial, and Purgatorial realms
Seraphic, Cherubic, and Angelic orders
Heaven, Hell, and Outer Darkness
correct_answer: Celestial, Terrestrial, and Telestial kingdoms
explanation: D&C 76 details a vision of the afterlife, naming the Celestial, Terrestrial, and Telestial kingdoms.

question_text: In LDS doctrine, what is the state of existence for the spirit after death and before the resurrection?
answers: The spirit world, where the dead await resurrection and may receive the gospel
Unconscious sleep with no awareness until Judgment Day
Immediate assignment to a final degree of glory
Reincarnation into a new mortal body
correct_answer: The spirit world, where the dead await resurrection and may receive the gospel
explanation: Alma 40:11–14 and D&C 138 teach that spirits go to the spirit world to await resurrection and can hear the gospel.

question_text: Which section of the Doctrine and Covenants discusses eternal marriage and addresses the principle associated with plural marriage?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 132
Doctrine and Covenants 76
Doctrine and Covenants 20
Doctrine and Covenants 121
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 132
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 132 contains the 1843 revelation on eternal marriage, which also addresses plural marriage.

question_text: In which year did Church leaders first publicly announce the practice of plural marriage in Utah Territory?
explanation: At a special conference in Salt Lake City on August 28, 1852, Orson Pratt announced the practice under Brigham Young's direction.

question_text: Which official Church document, canonized in the Doctrine and Covenants, announced the end of new plural marriages in the Church?
answers: Official Declaration 1
Official Declaration 2
The Articles of Faith
The Family: A Proclamation to the World
correct_answer: Official Declaration 1
explanation: President Wilford Woodruff’s 1890 Manifesto, included as Official Declaration 1, declared an end to new plural marriages.

question_text: According to the Church’s For the Strength of Youth guide, what is the standard regarding pornography?
answers: Avoid pornography in any form; it is harmful and never acceptable.
Viewing pornography in moderation is acceptable for adults.
Pornography is acceptable if used for art appreciation in museums.
Members may decide individually whether to view pornography.
correct_answer: Avoid pornography in any form; it is harmful and never acceptable.
explanation: Official Church standards for youth and adults teach to avoid pornography entirely because it is spiritually harmful.

question_text: Which scripture explicitly warns that looking with lust is adultery in the heart, a teaching often cited by the Church in counseling against pornography?
answers: Matthew 5:28
Moroni 10:4
Doctrine and Covenants 89:8
Abraham 3:22
correct_answer: Matthew 5:28
explanation: In the Sermon on the Mount, Jesus teaches that to look on another with lust is to commit adultery in the heart (Matthew 5:28), a principle the Church applies in warning against pornography.

question_text: According to official Church resources, what is an appropriate step for a member who is struggling with pornography?
answers: Talk with a bishop and seek help, including spiritual counseling and, if needed, professional support.
Keep the problem secret and try to resolve it alone.
Make a public confession during sacrament meeting.
Voluntarily stop taking the sacrament indefinitely without consulting a leader.
correct_answer: Talk with a bishop and seek help, including spiritual counseling and, if needed, professional support.
explanation: The Church encourages members to seek help from priesthood leaders and use available resources; secrecy or public confession in meetings is not taught.

question_text: According to Alma 40 in the Book of Mormon, what is the state of spirits between death and the resurrection?
answers: They enter the spirit world, where the righteous are in a state of paradise and the wicked in a state of darkness
They sleep unconsciously until the resurrection
They immediately receive final judgment and assignment to a degree of glory
They are reincarnated into new mortal bodies
correct_answer: They enter the spirit world, where the righteous are in a state of paradise and the wicked in a state of darkness
explanation: Alma 40:11–14 teaches that spirits are taken home to God; the righteous experience paradise (a state of happiness) and the wicked a state of darkness until the resurrection.

question_text: In LDS doctrine, who will be resurrected?
answers: All people, both the just and the unjust
Only baptized members of the Church
Only those who accepted Christ in mortality
Only the literal descendants of Israel
correct_answer: All people, both the just and the unjust
explanation: Scripture teaches universal resurrection through Christ (1 Corinthians 15:22; Alma 11:43–44).

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 138, how was the gospel preached to spirits in prison after Christ’s death?
answers: Christ organized and commissioned the righteous spirits to teach the disobedient in spirit prison
Christ personally visited every spirit in prison and taught them individually
No preaching occurs in the spirit world after death
Only mortal missionaries can teach the dead through dreams
correct_answer: Christ organized and commissioned the righteous spirits to teach the disobedient in spirit prison
explanation: D&C 138:29–37 states that the Lord visited the righteous in paradise and organized them to preach the gospel to those in spirit prison.

question_text: According to the teachings of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, to whom should prayers be addressed?
answers: Heavenly Father (God the Father)
Jesus Christ
The Holy Ghost
Mary, the mother of Jesus
correct_answer: Heavenly Father (God the Father)
explanation: Jesus taught to pray to the Father (Matthew 6:9; 3 Nephi 18:19). Latter-day Saints address prayers to Heavenly Father in the name of Jesus Christ.

question_text: Where in the standard works are the sacrament prayers recorded?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 20:77, 79 and Moroni 4-5
Articles of Faith 1:4
Alma 32
Matthew 28:19-20
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 20:77, 79 and Moroni 4-5
explanation: The revealed wording of the sacrament prayers is found in D&C 20:77, 79 and in Moroni 4-5.

question_text: According to Joseph Smith—History, which scripture prompted Joseph Smith to pray for wisdom leading to the First Vision?
answers: James 1:5
Moroni 10:4-5
John 3:16
Psalm 23
correct_answer: James 1:5
explanation: Joseph Smith read James 1:5 and was moved to ask God in prayer, as recorded in Joseph Smith—History 1:11-13.

question_text: Which passage in the Pearl of Great Price teaches that intelligences existed before the world and that Abraham was among the 'noble and great ones'?
answers: Abraham 3:22–23
Moses 1:39
Doctrine and Covenants 76:22–24
2 Nephi 2:25
correct_answer: Abraham 3:22–23
explanation: Abraham 3:22–23 explicitly states that intelligences existed before the world and identifies Abraham as one of the 'noble and great ones' chosen before birth.

question_text: According to Latter-day Saint scripture, what did Jesus Christ volunteer to do in the premortal Council in Heaven?
answers: Do the Father’s will and be the Savior, preserving human agency
Eliminate agency so that all would return and claim the Father’s glory for Himself
Create the earth without the Father’s direction
Remain a ministering angel without a mortal mission
correct_answer: Do the Father’s will and be the Savior, preserving human agency
explanation: Abraham 3:27 and Moses 4:1–2 describe the premortal council where Christ said, 'Here am I, send me' and upheld the Father’s plan that preserved agency.

question_text: In Latter-day Saint scripture, what does 'foreordination' in the premortal life mean?
answers: That some individuals were called or chosen before mortality for specific missions, contingent on their agency and faithfulness
That salvation and exaltation are fixed in advance regardless of choices
That only prophets existed before birth
That mortal choices cannot alter God’s plan in any way
correct_answer: That some individuals were called or chosen before mortality for specific missions, contingent on their agency and faithfulness
explanation: Alma 13:3 teaches that some were 'called and prepared from the foundation of the world' on account of their faith, and Abraham 3:22–23 speaks of noble and great spirits chosen before birth; foreordination does not negate agency.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 20, which ordinance is an Aaronic Priest authorized to perform?
answers: Baptize
Confirm members and confer the gift of the Holy Ghost
Ordain elders
Seal couples in the temple
correct_answer: Baptize
explanation: D&C 20:46, 50 states that priests may baptize and administer the sacrament; confirmation and sealing require Melchizedek Priesthood authority and temple sealing keys.

question_text: What is the minimum age for a worthy candidate to be ordained to the office of priest in the Aaronic Priesthood?
answers: 12 years old
14 years old
16 years old
18 years old
correct_answer: 16 years old
explanation: The General Handbook specifies that priests are typically ordained at age 16, subject to worthiness, interviews, and approval by presiding leaders.

question_text: Who is the president of the priests quorum in a ward of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints?
answers: The bishop
The elders quorum president
The stake president
The ward mission leader
correct_answer: The bishop
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 107:87–88 teaches that the bishop presides over the Aaronic Priesthood and is the president of the priests quorum; this is also reflected in the General Handbook.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 13, which priesthood holds the keys of the ministering of angels and of the gospel of repentance and of baptism?
answers: Aaronic Priesthood
Melchizedek Priesthood
Patriarchal order
Apostolic authority alone
correct_answer: Aaronic Priesthood
explanation: D&C 13 states that the Aaronic Priesthood holds the keys of the ministering of angels and of the gospel of repentance and of baptism.

question_text: In The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, who holds and is authorized to exercise all priesthood keys on the earth?
answers: The President of the Church
The Quorum of the Twelve Apostles collectively at all times
All stake presidents together
Every Melchizedek Priesthood holder
correct_answer: The President of the Church
explanation: Official teachings state that the President of the Church is the only person on earth authorized to exercise all priesthood keys; others hold or use keys by delegation.

question_text: Which heavenly messengers restored the Melchizedek Priesthood to Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery?
answers: Peter, James, and John
Moses, Elias, and Elijah
Moroni and Nephi
John the Baptist
correct_answer: Peter, James, and John
explanation: Revelations affirm that Peter, James, and John restored the Melchizedek Priesthood (see D&C 27:12; 128:20).

question_text: In which year did The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints announce, by revelation (Official Declaration 2), that priesthood ordination would be available to all worthy male members regardless of race and that temple blessings would be extended to all members?
explanation: Official Declaration 2, canonized in the Doctrine and Covenants, was issued in 1978, extending priesthood ordination to all worthy male members regardless of race and affirming temple blessings for all.

question_text: According to the Church's official 'Race and the Priesthood' essay, what is the Church’s position on theories once used to explain the former priesthood and temple restrictions on Black members?
answers: The Church disavows those theories and forbids their teaching.
Those theories were revealed doctrine and remain binding.
The Church has no official position and leaves the matter to individual interpretation.
The theories apply only outside North America.
correct_answer: The Church disavows those theories and forbids their teaching.
explanation: The Gospel Topics essay 'Race and the Priesthood' states that the Church disavows past theories advanced to explain the restrictions, including ideas about skin color as a sign of a curse or premortal behavior, and forbids their teaching.

question_text: Who signed Official Declaration 2 announcing the 1978 revelation on the priesthood?
answers: Spencer W. Kimball, N. Eldon Tanner, and Marion G. Romney
Joseph Fielding Smith, Harold B. Lee, and Gordon B. Hinckley
Brigham Young, Heber C. Kimball, and Willard Richards
The Quorum of the Twelve Apostles collectively, without the First Presidency
correct_answer: Spencer W. Kimball, N. Eldon Tanner, and Marion G. Romney
explanation: Official Declaration 2 is a letter from the First Presidency signed by President Spencer W. Kimball and his counselors, N. Eldon Tanner and Marion G. Romney.

question_text: According to official Church guidelines, who is authorized to give a priesthood blessing of comfort and counsel by the laying on of hands?
answers: A Melchizedek Priesthood holder
Any baptized member regardless of priesthood ordination
Any Aaronic Priesthood holder (deacon, teacher, or priest)
Only a bishop or stake president
correct_answer: A Melchizedek Priesthood holder
explanation: Blessings of comfort and counsel are given by Melchizedek Priesthood holders, as outlined in the Church’s General Handbook.

question_text: What is the correct sequence when administering to the sick in a priesthood blessing?
answers: Anoint with consecrated oil, then seal the anointing by the laying on of hands and pronounce the blessing
Seal the anointing by laying on of hands, then anoint with oil
Anoint with water, then seal the anointing
Offer a spoken prayer without laying on hands
correct_answer: Anoint with consecrated oil, then seal the anointing by the laying on of hands and pronounce the blessing
explanation: The ordinance has two parts in order: anointing with consecrated oil and then sealing the anointing with the laying on of hands, during which the blessing is pronounced.

question_text: If consecrated oil is not available, what may Melchizedek Priesthood holders do when asked to bless the sick?
answers: Give a blessing by the authority of the Melchizedek Priesthood without an anointing
Decline the request until consecrated oil can be obtained
Use any available oil without consecration
Ask an Aaronic Priesthood holder to perform the ordinance
correct_answer: Give a blessing by the authority of the Melchizedek Priesthood without an anointing
explanation: The General Handbook permits giving a blessing without anointing when consecrated oil is unavailable.

question_text: Which prophet restored the sealing keys to Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery in the Kirtland Temple in 1836?
answers: Elijah
Moses
Elias
John the Baptist
correct_answer: Elijah
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 110:13–16 records Elijah appearing in the Kirtland Temple to confer the sealing keys.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 13:1, what keys does the Aaronic Priesthood hold?
answers: The keys of the ministering of angels, and of the gospel of repentance, and of baptism by immersion for the remission of sins
The keys of the sealing power to bind on earth and in heaven
The keys of the gathering of Israel and directing the Church
The keys of ordaining apostles and prophets
correct_answer: The keys of the ministering of angels, and of the gospel of repentance, and of baptism by immersion for the remission of sins
explanation: D&C 13:1 explicitly states these are the keys associated with the Aaronic Priesthood.

question_text: Who is the only person on earth authorized to exercise all priesthood keys in The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints?
answers: The President of the Church
The Quorum of the Twelve Apostles collectively
Stake Presidents
All Melchizedek Priesthood holders
correct_answer: The President of the Church
explanation: The General Handbook and official teachings state that only the President of the Church is authorized to exercise all priesthood keys.

question_text: According to the Church's General Handbook, who directs Latter-day Saint religious services held inside a correctional facility?
answers: Local priesthood leaders designated by the stake president, in coordination with facility officials
The facility chaplain without any Church oversight
Any adult Melchizedek Priesthood holder who volunteers
Full-time missionaries assigned to the area
correct_answer: Local priesthood leaders designated by the stake president, in coordination with facility officials
explanation: The General Handbook states that ministry and meetings in correctional facilities occur only with facility permission and are organized under the direction of local Church leaders (e.g., stake president/bishop or a branch president where organized).

question_text: In the LDS Church, who holds the priesthood keys to authorize the baptism of an incarcerated person who is not yet a member?
answers: The mission president
The stake president of the facility's location
The prison chaplain
The elders quorum president
correct_answer: The mission president
explanation: Convert baptisms are performed under the keys of the mission president; in correctional settings, any teaching and ordinances must be coordinated with mission leaders and the facility.

question_text: What do official missionary standards state about proselyting in prisons and jails?
answers: Missionaries do not proselyte in correctional facilities unless specifically authorized by mission leaders and facility officials
Missionaries must visit every prison in their area weekly
Only zone leaders may enter prisons to proselyte
There are no restrictions on proselyting in prisons
correct_answer: Missionaries do not proselyte in correctional facilities unless specifically authorized by mission leaders and facility officials
explanation: Missionary Standards for Disciples of Jesus Christ instruct missionaries not to proselyte in places like prisons unless they have specific authorization.

question_text: According to Amos 3:7, how does the Lord reveal His purposes to humanity?
answers: He reveals His secrets to His servants the prophets
He records them only in sealed scripture that cannot be read
He communicates solely through angels to individuals
He never discloses His will to mortals
correct_answer: He reveals His secrets to His servants the prophets
explanation: Amos 3:7 states that the Lord reveals His secret to His servants the prophets before He acts.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 28:2 and 43:3–7, who is authorized to receive commandments and revelations that are binding on the entire Church?
answers: The President of the Church (the prophet)
Any holder of the Melchizedek Priesthood
The Quorum of the Twelve Apostles without the President
Stake presidents within their stakes
correct_answer: The President of the Church (the prophet)
explanation: D&C 28:2 and 43:3–7 teach that only the one appointed—initially Joseph Smith and, by extension, his successors—is authorized to receive commandments and revelations for the whole Church.

question_text: In Doctrine and Covenants 124:94–95, who is designated to be a 'prophet, seer, and revelator' to the Church in addition to Joseph Smith?
answers: Hyrum Smith
Oliver Cowdery
Sidney Rigdon
Brigham Young
correct_answer: Hyrum Smith
explanation: D&C 124:94–95 appoints Hyrum Smith to be a prophet, seer, and revelator to the Church, to act in concert with Joseph Smith.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 107, what is the maximum number of members in a deacons quorum?
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 107:85 states that a deacons quorum may number twelve.

question_text: In Doctrine and Covenants 107, which body is identified as a "traveling, presiding high council" with authority to officiate in all the affairs of the Church?
answers: The Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
The First Presidency
The Seventy
A stake high council
correct_answer: The Quorum of the Twelve Apostles
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 107:23, 33–35 designates the Twelve as a traveling, presiding high council with authority to officiate in all Church affairs.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 107, who serves as the president of the priests quorum?
answers: The bishop
The elders quorum president
The stake president
The priests quorum first assistant
correct_answer: The bishop
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 107:87–88 states that the bishop is the president of the priests quorum.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 107:23, what is the primary calling of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles?
answers: To be special witnesses of the name of Jesus Christ in all the world
To preside over temporal affairs of the Church
To oversee only the stakes in Zion
To act as patriarchs to the Church
correct_answer: To be special witnesses of the name of Jesus Christ in all the world
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 107:23 states that the Twelve are called to be "special witnesses of the name of Christ in all the world."

question_text: Under whose direction do the Twelve regulate the affairs of the Church, as described in Doctrine and Covenants 107:33?
answers: The First Presidency
Area Seventies
The Presiding Bishop
Stake Presidents
correct_answer: The First Presidency
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 107:33 describes the Twelve as a Traveling Presiding High Council who officiate "under the direction of the Presidency of the Church."

question_text: In which year was the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles first organized in the Church?
explanation: The Quorum of the Twelve Apostles was organized in February 1835 in Kirtland, Ohio, when the Three Witnesses selected the Twelve under Joseph Smith's direction.

topic: Race and The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
question_text: Which official Church document announced that priesthood and temple blessings are available to all worthy members regardless of race or color?
answers: Official Declaration 2 (Doctrine and Covenants)
The Articles of Faith
The Family: A Proclamation to the World
The Living Christ
correct_answer: Official Declaration 2 (Doctrine and Covenants)
explanation: Official Declaration 2, accepted in 1978, states that all worthy male members may be ordained to the priesthood without regard for race or color, opening priesthood and temple blessings to all.

topic: Race and The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
question_text: On what date did the First Presidency announce the 1978 revelation extending priesthood ordination to all worthy males regardless of race?
answers: June 8, 1978
April 6, 1830
September 24, 1890
October 6, 1979
correct_answer: June 8, 1978
explanation: The First Presidency’s announcement of the revelation is dated June 8, 1978, as recorded with Official Declaration 2 in the Doctrine and Covenants.

topic: Race and The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
question_text: According to the Church’s Gospel Topics essay “Race and the Priesthood,” which statement is accurate?
