answers: The Church disavows theories that black skin is a sign of divine disfavor.
The priesthood and temple restrictions were instituted by Joseph Smith.
The 1978 change is described as a policy decision rather than a revelation.
The essay states that racial restrictions remain in some parts of the world.
correct_answer: The Church disavows theories that black skin is a sign of divine disfavor.
explanation: The Gospel Topics essay explicitly disavows past theories that black skin is a sign of a curse or divine disfavor and condemns racism in any form.

question_text: Which scripture in the Book of Mormon explicitly teaches that all people are alike unto God, denouncing prejudice based on race, nationality, or social status?
answers: 2 Nephi 26:33
Alma 32:21
Mosiah 2:17
3 Nephi 11:29
correct_answer: 2 Nephi 26:33
explanation: 2 Nephi 26:33 states that the Lord invites all to come unto Him and that 'all are alike unto God.'

question_text: In what year did The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints announce the revelation extending priesthood ordination to all worthy male members regardless of race (Official Declaration 2)?
explanation: Official Declaration 2, added to the Doctrine and Covenants, was announced in 1978.

question_text: According to the Church's Gospel Topics essay 'Race and the Priesthood,' which statement is accurate?
answers: The Church disavows theories that black skin is a sign of divine disfavor or a curse and condemns racism in any form.
Skin color reflects premortal valiance and determines priesthood eligibility.
The Church has no official position regarding racism or racial theories.
The priesthood restriction remains doctrinally in force today.
correct_answer: The Church disavows theories that black skin is a sign of divine disfavor or a curse and condemns racism in any form.
explanation: The essay explicitly disavows past racial theories and condemns racism.

question_text: On what date and in which location was the Relief Society formally organized?
answers: March 17, 1842, in Nauvoo, Illinois
April 6, 1830, in Fayette, New York
July 24, 1847, in the Salt Lake Valley
January 1, 1851, in Salt Lake City, Utah Territory
correct_answer: March 17, 1842, in Nauvoo, Illinois
explanation: Joseph Smith organized the Female Relief Society of Nauvoo on March 17, 1842, in the upper room of his Red Brick Store in Nauvoo, Illinois.

question_text: Which of the following is one of the stated purposes of the Relief Society as outlined in the Church's General Handbook?
answers: To help women increase faith in Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ and His Atonement
To administer priesthood ordinances in wards and branches
To determine local tithing rates and conduct tithing settlement
To supervise Aaronic Priesthood quorum instruction
correct_answer: To help women increase faith in Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ and His Atonement
explanation: The General Handbook states that Relief Society prepares women for the blessings of eternal life by helping them increase faith in Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ and His Atonement, strengthen individuals and families, and help those in need.

question_text: What is the long-standing motto associated with the Relief Society?
answers: Charity never faileth
Faith, hope, and charity
Holiness to the Lord
Choose the right
correct_answer: Charity never faileth
explanation: “Charity never faileth” (1 Corinthians 13:8) has been used in official Church publications as the Relief Society motto.

question_text: According to official Church communications, what is The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints' position on the scientific theory of evolution?
answers: The Church has no official position on the theory of evolution.
The Church officially rejects evolution as incompatible with doctrine.
The Church requires members to accept evolution as the means of creation.
The Church teaches that evolution occurred only before Adam and Eve.
correct_answer: The Church has no official position on the theory of evolution.
explanation: Official Church communications state there is no official position on evolution; members may hold a range of views consistent with faith.

question_text: Which scripture explicitly states, "The glory of God is intelligence, or, in other words, light and truth"?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 93:36
Doctrine and Covenants 88:118
Pearl of Great Price, Moses 1:39
Book of Mormon, Alma 32:21
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 93:36
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 93:36 contains the exact phrase, linking God's glory with intelligence and truth.

question_text: According to the Church's Gospel Topics essay "Book of Mormon and DNA Studies," which scientific factor best explains why modern DNA testing cannot reliably identify the ancestry of Book of Mormon peoples?
answers: Genetic drift, population bottlenecks, and subsequent migrations can obscure ancient genetic signals.
No DNA samples from ancient America have ever been found.
DNA laboratories worldwide refuse to analyze Native American samples.
The essay states that all Native American DNA is purely Israelite.
correct_answer: Genetic drift, population bottlenecks, and subsequent migrations can obscure ancient genetic signals.
explanation: The essay explains that processes like genetic drift, bottlenecks, and admixture over millennia make definitive DNA conclusions about Book of Mormon populations unreliable.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 98, how are Latter-day Saints instructed to respond to aggression and war?
answers: Forgive offenses multiple times, renounce war and proclaim peace, and defend themselves only after repeated unprovoked attacks
Launch preemptive strikes to deter potential enemies
Adopt absolute pacifism, refusing any use of force under any circumstances
Leave all matters of defense solely to civil authorities and take no personal or collective action
correct_answer: Forgive offenses multiple times, renounce war and proclaim peace, and defend themselves only after repeated unprovoked attacks
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 98 teaches to renounce war and proclaim peace, forgive repeatedly, and only defend after repeated unprovoked offenses (see D&C 98:16, 23–38).

question_text: In the Book of Mormon, what best describes Captain Moroni’s approach to warfare?
answers: He fought defensive wars to protect liberty, religion, and families, without seeking power or delighting in bloodshed
He sought to conquer neighboring lands to expand Nephite influence
He advocated unprovoked attacks to eliminate threats quickly
He rejected all military action and taught total pacifism
correct_answer: He fought defensive wars to protect liberty, religion, and families, without seeking power or delighting in bloodshed
explanation: Alma 43–48 depict Captain Moroni as fighting only in defense of his people’s liberty, religion, and families, and as not delighting in bloodshed (e.g., Alma 43:46–47; 48:11, 14, 23).

question_text: According to the Church’s General Handbook, how should leaders respond when they learn of abuse or violence?
answers: Ensure immediate safety, comply with legal reporting requirements, contact the Church’s abuse help line where available, and support victims spiritually and practically
Handle the situation only through Church discipline and discourage reporting to civil authorities
Counsel victims to forgive and remain in the situation without involving outside help
Wait until there is a criminal conviction before taking any action
correct_answer: Ensure immediate safety, comply with legal reporting requirements, contact the Church’s abuse help line where available, and support victims spiritually and practically
explanation: The General Handbook condemns abuse, instructs leaders to protect and support victims, follow the law, and use the Church’s resources (such as the abuse help line where available).

question_text: According to the Eleventh Article of Faith of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, which statement best summarizes the Church's position on religious freedom?
answers: Latter-day Saints claim and grant to all people the privilege to worship according to the dictates of their own conscience
Freedom of worship applies only to Christians who accept biblical creeds
Religious freedom should be limited to private belief without public practice
Government should determine acceptable forms of worship to preserve order
correct_answer: Latter-day Saints claim and grant to all people the privilege to worship according to the dictates of their own conscience
explanation: Article of Faith 11 declares the right to worship according to conscience and extends the same privilege to all people: 'let them worship how, where, or what they may.'

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 134, what is the proper role of civil government regarding religion?
answers: Protect freedom of conscience and permit the free exercise of religion without favoring one church
Establish a state church to promote public morality
Regulate doctrine and punish heresy to ensure social harmony
Require tithes to support recognized religious institutions
correct_answer: Protect freedom of conscience and permit the free exercise of religion without favoring one church
explanation: D&C 134:2, 4, and 7 teach that governments should secure the free exercise of conscience, not control religious belief, and show no preference to any church.

question_text: According to the Church’s official Gospel Topics entry on 'Religious Freedom,' what principle are members encouraged to support?
answers: The protection of religious freedom for people of all faiths and beliefs, including those with no faith
Legal protection of Latter-day Saint beliefs as the sole recognized religion
Limiting religious freedom to private worship without public expression
Using government authority to privilege majority religions
correct_answer: The protection of religious freedom for people of all faiths and beliefs, including those with no faith
explanation: The Gospel Topics entry affirms religious freedom as a fundamental right that benefits all and encourages members to defend it broadly for everyone.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 58:43, how can we know if a person has truly repented?
answers: They confess and forsake their sins
They fast for forty days
They publicly announce their sins
They perform a set number of good deeds
correct_answer: They confess and forsake their sins
explanation: D&C 58:43 states that evidence of repentance is that a person confesses and forsakes their sins.

question_text: According to the General Handbook of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, to whom should members confess serious sins?
answers: Their bishop or branch president
Their ministering brothers or sisters
Their quorum or class presidency
A trusted friend or family member
correct_answer: Their bishop or branch president
explanation: The General Handbook directs members to confess serious sins to a bishop or branch president, who holds priesthood keys to help with repentance.

question_text: In the fourth Article of Faith, how is repentance described among the first principles and ordinances of the Gospel?
answers: It is the second principle, following faith in Jesus Christ
It is the first ordinance, preceding baptism
It is not included among the first principles and ordinances
It is a higher law reserved for temple covenants
correct_answer: It is the second principle, following faith in Jesus Christ
explanation: Article of Faith 4 lists repentance as the second of the first principles and ordinances of the Gospel, after faith in Jesus Christ.

question_text: According to Joseph Smith—History in the Pearl of Great Price, who appeared to Joseph Smith in the First Vision?
answers: God the Father and Jesus Christ
The angel Moroni and Nephi
Peter, James, and John
Moses and Elijah
correct_answer: God the Father and Jesus Christ
explanation: Joseph Smith—History 1 states that two Personages, God the Father and His Son Jesus Christ, appeared to Joseph Smith.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 13, what keys are associated with the Aaronic Priesthood restored by John the Baptist?
answers: The keys of the ministering of angels, the gospel of repentance, and of baptism by immersion for the remission of sins
The keys of the gathering of Israel and sealing power
The keys of the dispensation of the gospel of Abraham and celestial marriage
The keys of prophecy and revelation to all nations
correct_answer: The keys of the ministering of angels, the gospel of repentance, and of baptism by immersion for the remission of sins
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 13 explicitly lists these keys as belonging to the Aaronic Priesthood restored by John the Baptist.

question_text: Who appeared to Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery in the Kirtland Temple to confer priesthood keys as recorded in Doctrine and Covenants 110?
answers: Moses, Elias, and Elijah
Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob
Nephi, Lehi, and Samuel the Lamanite
Adam, Enoch, and Noah
correct_answer: Moses, Elias, and Elijah
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 110 records that after the appearance of the Savior, Moses, Elias, and Elijah appeared and committed specific priesthood keys.

question_text: Which section of Latter-day Saint scripture records the words spoken by John the Baptist when conferring the Aaronic Priesthood upon Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 13
Doctrine and Covenants 20
Joseph Smith—History 1:68–72
Articles of Faith 1:5
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 13
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 13 preserves the exact words of John the Baptist conferring the Aaronic Priesthood, including the keys of the ministering of angels, repentance, and baptism; Joseph Smith—History 1:68–72 narrates the event but does not give the full wording.

question_text: On what date did John the Baptist confer the Aaronic Priesthood upon Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery?
answers: April 6, 1830
September 21, 1823
explanation: Joseph Smith—History 1:68 specifies that the visitation of John the Baptist and the conferral of the Aaronic Priesthood occurred on May 15, 1829.

question_text: According to official Latter-day Saint sources, which apostles restored the Melchizedek Priesthood to Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery?
answers: Moroni
Peter, James, and John
Moses, Elias, and Elijah
John the Baptist
correct_answer: Peter, James, and John
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 27:12–13 and 128:20 identify Peter, James, and John as the messengers who ordained Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery and conferred the keys of the Melchizedek Priesthood.

question_text: In Latter-day Saint doctrine, what is the resurrection?
answers: The reuniting of the spirit with a perfected, immortal body, never to die again.
The spirit continuing as a disembodied intelligence forever.
The reincarnation of the soul into a new mortal body.
A symbolic spiritual rebirth at baptism.
correct_answer: The reuniting of the spirit with a perfected, immortal body, never to die again.
explanation: Scripture teaches that in the resurrection the spirit reunites with the body, restored and immortal (Alma 11:42-45; Alma 40:23; 1 Corinthians 15:42-53).

question_text: According to scripture, who will be resurrected?
answers: All people who have ever lived on earth, both righteous and wicked.
Only those who accepted Jesus Christ in mortality.
Only those who were baptized by proper authority.
Only the righteous during the Millennium.
correct_answer: All people who have ever lived on earth, both righteous and wicked.
explanation: The Bible and Book of Mormon teach universal resurrection through Christ (1 Corinthians 15:22; Alma 11:44; Helaman 14:17).

question_text: In Latter-day Saint belief, what does Paul's statement that Christ is the 'firstfruits of them that slept' signify?
answers: That Jesus Christ was the first to be resurrected, opening the way for the resurrection of all.
That the first converts after Christ's resurrection were especially favored.
That John the Baptist was resurrected before Jesus.
That Paul was referring only to an ancient Israelite harvest festival.
correct_answer: That Jesus Christ was the first to be resurrected, opening the way for the resurrection of all.
explanation: Paul teaches Christ's literal resurrection and that He rose first, assuring the resurrection of all (1 Corinthians 15:20-23; Mosiah 16:7-8).

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 8:2–3, by what means does the Lord reveal truth to individuals?
answers: By the Holy Ghost to the mind and heart
Only through audible voices and open visions
Exclusively via angelic visitations
By outward signs in nature without inward impressions
correct_answer: By the Holy Ghost to the mind and heart
explanation: D&C 8:2–3 teaches that the Lord communicates by the Holy Ghost, telling us in our mind and in our heart.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 28 and 43, who is authorized to receive revelations to guide the entire Church?
answers: The President of the Church, who holds the keys of revelation for the Church
Any member who feels strongly impressed by the Spirit
Stake presidents acting jointly
The teachers quorum presidency in each ward
correct_answer: The President of the Church, who holds the keys of revelation for the Church
explanation: D&C 28:2 and 43:2–7 state that only the one appointed holds authority to receive commandments and revelations for the Church.

question_text: Which Article of Faith affirms belief in continuing revelation—that God will yet reveal many great and important things pertaining to the Kingdom of God?
answers: Article of Faith 9
Article of Faith 3
Article of Faith 13
Article of Faith 1
correct_answer: Article of Faith 9
explanation: Article of Faith 9 explicitly declares belief in past, present, and future revelation from God.

question_text: According to the Church’s Gospel Topics entry on 'Reverence,' how is reverence best defined?
answers: A deep respect and love for God that influences thoughts, words, and actions
Merely being quiet during church meetings
Strict rule-keeping without regard to feelings or intent
Fear of divine punishment that discourages personal expression
correct_answer: A deep respect and love for God that influences thoughts, words, and actions
explanation: The Gospel Topics entry teaches that reverence is a profound respect and love for God and sacred things, which guides behavior; it is more than just being quiet.

question_text: In the General Handbook, what is the stated purpose of prelude music in sacrament meeting?
answers: To create a reverent atmosphere and invite the Spirit
To provide entertainment before the meeting begins
To signal the start and end of the meeting through volume changes
To give musicians an opportunity to practice publicly
correct_answer: To create a reverent atmosphere and invite the Spirit
explanation: The General Handbook explains that prelude music helps establish a reverent atmosphere and invites the Spirit in sacrament meeting.

question_text: Which passage in the Latter-day Saint canon explicitly uses the word 'reverence' in describing acceptable worship?
answers: Hebrews 12:28
Doctrine and Covenants 59:9
3 Nephi 18:5
Alma 37:36
correct_answer: Hebrews 12:28
explanation: Hebrews 12:28 (KJV) states that we should 'serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear.' The other passages address worship or ordinances but do not use the word 'reverence.'

question_text: Which day do Latter-day Saints observe as the Sabbath, and what is the primary reason for that observance?
answers: Sunday, in commemoration of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ
Saturday, in remembrance of the seventh day of Creation
Friday, to align with ancient Israelite practice
Any day of the week chosen by local leaders
correct_answer: Sunday, in commemoration of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ
explanation: Latter-day Saints observe the Sabbath on Sunday to commemorate the Resurrection of Jesus Christ, consistent with Christian practice (see Gospel Topics: “Sabbath Day”; D&C 59 teaches to keep the Sabbath holy).

question_text: Which section of the Doctrine and Covenants instructs members to "offer up thy sacraments upon my holy day"?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 59
Doctrine and Covenants 20
Doctrine and Covenants 76
Doctrine and Covenants 89
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 59
explanation: The directive appears in D&C 59:9, which outlines principles of Sabbath observance given through Joseph Smith in 1831.

question_text: According to the General Handbook, what is a central purpose of Sabbath day observance for Church members?
answers: To worship the Lord and renew covenants by partaking of the sacrament
To avoid all travel and remain at home all day
To complete household chores and employment tasks
To attend required meetings for at least six hours
correct_answer: To worship the Lord and renew covenants by partaking of the sacrament
explanation: The General Handbook teaches that the Sabbath is set apart for worship and rest; members should attend sacrament meeting to renew covenants through the sacrament (see General Handbook 29.5).

question_text: Which Aaronic Priesthood office is authorized to bless the sacrament in Latter-day Saint practice?
answers: Deacon
Teacher
Priest
Elder
correct_answer: Priest
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 20:46 states that priests have authority to administer the sacrament.

question_text: In the Doctrine and Covenants, where are the sacrament prayers (for bread and water) recorded?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 20:77, 79
Doctrine and Covenants 27:2–5
Doctrine and Covenants 59:9–12
Doctrine and Covenants 84:20–22
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 20:77, 79
explanation: D&C 20:77 and 79 contain the exact wording of the sacrament prayers used for the bread and the water.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 27, which statement about the emblems used in the sacrament is correct?
answers: Water may be used; it “mattereth not” what is eaten or drunk if done with an eye single to God’s glory
Only wine blessed by priesthood holders is acceptable
Only unfermented grape juice may be used
The sacrament should not include any drink
correct_answer: Water may be used; it “mattereth not” what is eaten or drunk if done with an eye single to God’s glory
explanation: D&C 27:2 teaches that it does not matter what is eaten or drunk in the sacrament if done properly; wine is not required, and water is acceptable.

question_text: Under the Church’s current Sunday schedule, how long is a standard sacrament meeting intended to last?
answers: 60 minutes
90 minutes
45 minutes
75 minutes
correct_answer: 60 minutes
explanation: Since January 2019, sacrament meeting is scheduled for 60 minutes as part of the two-hour Sunday schedule outlined by the First Presidency and the General Handbook.

question_text: In a typical sacrament meeting, which hymn is sung immediately before the bread and water are blessed and passed?
answers: The sacrament hymn
The opening hymn
A choir anthem
The closing hymn
correct_answer: The sacrament hymn
explanation: The General Handbook directs that a sacrament hymn be sung, after which the sacrament is blessed and passed.

question_text: Which priesthood office is authorized to bless the sacrament in sacrament meeting?
answers: Priest (Aaronic Priesthood)
Deacon (Aaronic Priesthood)
Teacher (Aaronic Priesthood)
Bishop
correct_answer: Priest (Aaronic Priesthood)
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 20 states that priests have authority to administer (bless) the sacrament; deacons pass and teachers prepare under direction. Melchizedek Priesthood holders may also assist when authorized.

question_text: According to Moses 5:5–8, what was the divine purpose of the animal sacrifices Adam was commanded to offer after leaving the Garden of Eden?
answers: To foreshadow the sacrifice of the Only Begotten Son
To appease local deities
To obtain temporal prosperity
To celebrate seasonal harvests
correct_answer: To foreshadow the sacrifice of the Only Begotten Son
explanation: An angel taught Adam that his sacrifices were a similitude of the sacrifice of the Only Begotten (Moses 5:7–8).

question_text: After the Atonement of Jesus Christ, what sacrifice did He declare His followers should offer instead of animal sacrifices?
answers: A broken heart and a contrite spirit
Annual firstfruits offerings
The blood of bulls and goats
A monetary tithe of all increase
correct_answer: A broken heart and a contrite spirit
explanation: Jesus declared that blood sacrifices were done away and commanded the sacrifice of a broken heart and a contrite spirit (3 Nephi 9:19–20; D&C 59:8).

question_text: In Alma 34, what kind of sacrifice did Amulek teach was necessary to atone for the sins of the world?
answers: An infinite and eternal sacrifice
A yearly Passover lamb
A sacrifice of grain and oil
The firstborn of every flock
correct_answer: An infinite and eternal sacrifice
explanation: Amulek taught that it must be an infinite and eternal sacrifice, fulfilled in Jesus Christ (Alma 34:10–14).

question_text: In Latter-day Saint doctrine, what does 'salvation' in its universal sense primarily refer to?
answers: The resurrection of all humanity through the Atonement of Jesus Christ
Entering the celestial kingdom with exaltation
Forgiveness of sins without repentance
Receiving the priesthood
correct_answer: The resurrection of all humanity through the Atonement of Jesus Christ
explanation: Because of Christ's Atonement, all people will be resurrected, overcoming physical death (1 Corinthians 15; 2 Nephi 9; Alma 11).

question_text: According to the Fourth Article of Faith, which are the first principles and ordinances of the Gospel necessary for personal salvation?
answers: Faith in Jesus Christ, repentance, baptism by immersion, laying on of hands for the gift of the Holy Ghost
Tithing, fasting, missionary work, temple marriage
Prayer, scripture study, service, Sabbath observance
Confession, confirmation, communion, penance
correct_answer: Faith in Jesus Christ, repentance, baptism by immersion, laying on of hands for the gift of the Holy Ghost
explanation: The Fourth Article of Faith lists these as the first principles and ordinances of the Gospel.

question_text: According to Latter-day Saint scripture, by what means alone can humankind be saved?
answers: Only in and through the name of Jesus Christ
By strict obedience to the law of Moses
Through the intercession of prophets and angels
By personal righteousness alone without grace
correct_answer: Only in and through the name of Jesus Christ
explanation: Book of Mormon passages teach there is no other name or way whereby man can be saved, only in and through Christ (Mosiah 3:17; 2 Nephi 25:20; see Acts 4:12).

question_text: According to official teachings of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, how is experiencing same-sex attraction itself regarded?
answers: Experiencing same-sex attraction is not a sin; sin involves sexual relations outside marriage between a man and a woman
Experiencing same-sex attraction is a serious transgression requiring a membership council
Experiencing same-sex attraction must be repented of before baptism
Experiencing same-sex attraction automatically disqualifies a member from callings
correct_answer: Experiencing same-sex attraction is not a sin; sin involves sexual relations outside marriage between a man and a woman
explanation: Official Church materials teach that attraction itself is not a sin; the law of chastity requires sexual relations only between a man and a woman who are married.

question_text: What does the law of chastity require of Latter-day Saints who experience same-sex attraction?
answers: The same standard as all members: no sexual relations outside marriage between a man and a woman
Lifelong celibacy regardless of marital status
Participation in therapy to change orientation before baptism or temple attendance
Avoidance of church callings
correct_answer: The same standard as all members: no sexual relations outside marriage between a man and a woman
explanation: The law of chastity applies equally to all members: sexual relations are permitted only within marriage between a man and a woman.

question_text: Does experiencing same-sex attraction by itself prevent a person from receiving a temple recommend in the LDS Church?
answers: No. Temple worthiness is based on obedience to commandments and covenants, not sexual orientation
Yes. Any same-sex attraction disqualifies a person
Only if the person publicly identifies as LGBTQ
Only if family members oppose it
correct_answer: No. Temple worthiness is based on obedience to commandments and covenants, not sexual orientation
explanation: Official policy bases temple recommend eligibility on worthiness standards (including the law of chastity), not on a person’s sexual orientation.

question_text: According to official teachings of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, what is the doctrinal definition of marriage?
answers: Marriage between a man and a woman is ordained of God
Marriage between any consenting adults is doctrinally equivalent
The Church has no official doctrine defining marriage
Local leaders determine the definition of marriage for their area
correct_answer: Marriage between a man and a woman is ordained of God
explanation: The Family: A Proclamation to the World states that “marriage between a man and a woman is ordained of God,” and the General Handbook affirms that sexual relations are reserved for a marriage between a man and a woman.

question_text: What is the Church’s policy regarding performing or allowing same-sex marriages in temples or meetinghouses?
answers: The Church does not perform same-sex marriages or sealings and does not permit its facilities to be used for them
Same-sex civil marriages may be performed in meetinghouses with bishop approval
Same-sex temple sealings are allowed in limited circumstances
The Church will perform same-sex marriages where civil law requires it
correct_answer: The Church does not perform same-sex marriages or sealings and does not permit its facilities to be used for them
explanation: The General Handbook specifies that temple sealings and marriages are between a man and a woman, and Church facilities may not be used for ceremonies that conflict with Church doctrine.

question_text: What change did the First Presidency announce in April 2019 regarding same-sex marriage and the children of parents in same-sex relationships?
answers: Same-sex marriage would no longer be treated as apostasy for mandatory discipline, and children of parents in same-sex relationships could be blessed and baptized without First Presidency approval
The Church began performing same-sex marriages in temples
Children of parents in same-sex relationships were prohibited from receiving any ordinances until age 21
Support for same-sex marriage as public policy became a temple recommend question
correct_answer: Same-sex marriage would no longer be treated as apostasy for mandatory discipline, and children of parents in same-sex relationships could be blessed and baptized without First Presidency approval
explanation: On April 4, 2019, the First Presidency announced that while same-sex marriage remains a serious transgression, it is no longer automatically classified as apostasy requiring mandatory discipline; children of parents in same-sex relationships may receive baby blessings and baptism without First Presidency approval.

question_text: In Latter-day Saint scripture, what did Lucifer propose in the premortal council that led to his being cast out as Satan?
answers: To save all mankind by removing their agency and to claim God’s honor
To uphold agency while volunteering to atone and give all glory to the Father
To delay the Plan of Salvation until a later time
To become the first mortal to set an example for others
correct_answer: To save all mankind by removing their agency and to claim God’s honor
explanation: Moses 4:1–4 and D&C 29:36–37 teach that Lucifer sought to destroy agency and to take God’s honor, leading to his being cast out and becoming Satan.

question_text: According to Latter-day Saint scripture, who was Lucifer before his rebellion?
answers: A spirit son of God, an angel in authority, called a “son of the morning”
An uncreated being co-equal with God in power and authority
A mortal king who later became a mythologized symbol
A purely symbolic personification of human evil impulses
correct_answer: A spirit son of God, an angel in authority, called a “son of the morning”
explanation: D&C 76:25–27 describes Lucifer as an angel in authority who rebelled; 2 Nephi 24:12 (Isaiah 14:12) refers to him as “Lucifer, son of the morning.”

question_text: According to Latter-day Saint doctrine, does Satan have a physical body?
answers: No; he is a spirit and does not possess a physical body
Yes; he has a resurrected, glorified body
Yes; he currently has a mortal body of flesh and blood
He can create a physical body for himself at will
correct_answer: No; he is a spirit and does not possess a physical body
explanation: Abraham 3:26–28 indicates those who kept not their first estate were not added upon (no mortal body). D&C 129:8 implies devils are spirits without bodies; see also 2 Nephi 9:8–9.

question_text: Which books comprise the Latter-day Saint "standard works" (the Church's scriptural canon)?
answers: The Holy Bible, the Book of Mormon, the Doctrine and Covenants, and the Pearl of Great Price
The Holy Bible, the Book of Mormon, the Journal of Discourses, and the Pearl of Great Price
The Holy Bible, the Book of Mormon, the Doctrine and Covenants, and the Apocrypha
The Holy Bible, the Book of Mormon, Lectures on Faith, and the Pearl of Great Price
correct_answer: The Holy Bible, the Book of Mormon, the Doctrine and Covenants, and the Pearl of Great Price
explanation: The LDS canon consists of four standard works: the Bible, Book of Mormon, Doctrine and Covenants, and Pearl of Great Price.

question_text: According to the Eighth Article of Faith, what is the Church's position on the Bible?
answers: We believe the Bible to be the word of God as far as it is translated correctly
We accept only the Old Testament as scripture
We believe the Bible is infallible in every manuscript
We use only modern translations and do not rely on ancient texts
correct_answer: We believe the Bible to be the word of God as far as it is translated correctly
explanation: The Eighth Article of Faith states this exact principle about the Bible.

question_text: Which English-language Bible translation does the Church officially use in its English-language teaching and publications?
answers: King James Version (KJV)
New International Version (NIV)
New Revised Standard Version (NRSV)
New King James Version (NKJV)
correct_answer: King James Version (KJV)
explanation: The Church’s official English Bible is the King James Version as stated in Church handbooks and publications.

question_text: In Latter-day Saint doctrine, what does the ordinance of 'sealing' primarily do?
answers: Binds individuals in eternal family relationships by priesthood authority
Confirms a member and bestows the gift of the Holy Ghost
Ordains a person to the Aaronic Priesthood office of priest
Symbolically commemorates covenants without legal effect
correct_answer: Binds individuals in eternal family relationships by priesthood authority
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 132 and 128 teach that the sealing power binds on earth and in heaven, uniting families eternally.

question_text: Where are marriages for time and eternity (sealings) for living members authorized to be performed in The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints?
answers: In dedicated temples by those authorized to use the sealing keys
In any meetinghouse chapel by the bishop
At a civil venue if a member holds a temple recommend
Only outdoors in the presence of two witnesses
correct_answer: In dedicated temples by those authorized to use the sealing keys
explanation: Sealings are temple ordinances performed by authorized sealers acting under priesthood keys held by the President of the Church (see D&C 132:7; General Handbook).

question_text: According to Church policy, what is the status of a child born to parents who have been sealed in the temple at the time of the child's birth?
answers: The child is born in the covenant and is automatically sealed to the parents
The child must be sealed to the parents after baptism at age eight
The child cannot be sealed until endowed
The child is considered sealed only if blessed by a high priest
correct_answer: The child is born in the covenant and is automatically sealed to the parents
explanation: The General Handbook states that children born to parents who are already sealed are 'born in the covenant' and need no additional sealing.

question_text: According to scripture, who knows the exact day and hour of the Second Coming of Jesus Christ?
answers: Only the Father
The President of the Church
All faithful prophets
The angels in heaven
correct_answer: Only the Father
explanation: Jesus taught that of that day and hour knows no one but the Father (Matthew 24:36; see also D&C 49:7).

question_text: In Latter-day Saint scripture, where will the Lord stand to deliver the Jews at His Second Coming?
answers: The Mount of Olives
Mount Sinai
The Vatican Hill
Mecca
correct_answer: The Mount of Olives
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 45:48, 51–53 (cf. Zechariah 14:4) teaches that His feet will stand upon the Mount of Olives when He delivers the Jews.

question_text: Which of the following is identified in scripture as a sign that will precede the Second Coming?
answers: The gospel will be preached in all the world
All wars will cease
The exact date will be publicly announced
No temples will operate on earth
correct_answer: The gospel will be preached in all the world
explanation: Matthew 24:14 and Joseph Smith—Matthew 1:31 state that the gospel will be preached in all the world before the end comes.

question_text: According to official Church materials, how is self-reliance defined in The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints?
answers: The ability, commitment, and effort to provide the spiritual and temporal necessities of life for self and family.
Complete financial independence from any institution, including the Church and government.
The capacity to live off stored food for one year without outside help.
Never accepting assistance from others under any circumstances.
correct_answer: The ability, commitment, and effort to provide the spiritual and temporal necessities of life for self and family.
explanation: The Church’s Gospel Topics defines self-reliance as the ability, commitment, and effort to provide spiritual and temporal necessities for oneself and family.

question_text: Which scripture contains the directive related to work and self-reliance: "Thou shalt not be idle; for he that is idle shall not eat the bread nor wear the garments of the laborer"?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 42:42
Doctrine and Covenants 89:18
Mosiah 2:17
Matthew 25:40
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 42:42
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 42:42 teaches against idleness and supports the principle of work central to self-reliance.

question_text: According to the General Handbook, what is the expected order of responsibility when members face temporal needs?
answers: Personal resources and efforts, then family support, then Church assistance as needed.
Church assistance first, then family, then personal resources.
Government aid first, then Church assistance, then personal resources.
Employer assistance, then government aid, then Church assistance.
correct_answer: Personal resources and efforts, then family support, then Church assistance as needed.
explanation: The General Handbook teaches that individuals and families are primarily responsible for their own welfare; if further help is needed, they may seek support from family and then the Church.

question_text: Which Book of Mormon verse explicitly teaches that serving others is serving God?
answers: Mosiah 2:17
Alma 34:28
Moroni 7:47
3 Nephi 27:21
correct_answer: Mosiah 2:17
explanation: King Benjamin taught, "when ye are in the service of your fellow beings ye are only in the service of your God" (Mosiah 2:17).

question_text: According to the Church’s General Handbook, what is the primary purpose of ministering?
answers: Provide prayerful, individualized care and service to assigned individuals and families under the direction of elders quorum/Relief Society leaders and the bishop
Make a scheduled monthly visit to deliver a set lesson (home/visiting teaching)
Collect tithing and fast offerings from assigned families
Focus primarily on proselyting to nonmembers in assigned households
correct_answer: Provide prayerful, individualized care and service to assigned individuals and families under the direction of elders quorum/Relief Society leaders and the bishop
explanation: The General Handbook teaches that ministering is inspired, personalized care to help meet spiritual and temporal needs, coordinated by ward leaders—not delivering a set monthly lesson.

question_text: What is JustServe in the context of the Church?
answers: A Church-sponsored website and app that connects volunteers with community service opportunities without proselytizing expectations
A welfare fund members donate to during fast Sunday
A full-time missionary assignment for young adults
The Church’s seminary and institute curriculum for youth and young adults
correct_answer: A Church-sponsored website and app that connects volunteers with community service opportunities without proselytizing expectations
explanation: JustServe.org is an official Church initiative that lists community service projects and invites volunteers of any faith; it is not used for proselytizing.

question_text: According to official Church teachings, when are sexual relations appropriate under the law of chastity?
answers: Only between a man and a woman who are legally and lawfully married
Between consenting adults in a committed relationship
Between engaged couples who plan to marry soon
Whenever two people sincerely love each other
correct_answer: Only between a man and a woman who are legally and lawfully married
explanation: The law of chastity reserves sexual relations for a man and a woman who are legally and lawfully married (General Handbook; For the Strength of Youth; The Family: A Proclamation to the World).

question_text: Who has the primary responsibility to teach children and youth about physical intimacy and sexual development in the Church?
answers: Parents in the home, with support from Church resources and leaders as needed
Bishops during worthiness interviews
Sunday School teachers through formal sex education lessons
Public school educators rather than the family
correct_answer: Parents in the home, with support from Church resources and leaders as needed
explanation: The General Handbook and official materials (e.g., A Parent’s Guide) state that parents have the primary duty to teach their children about sexual matters; leaders support and avoid explicit content.

question_text: What is the Church’s official guidance for leaders when teaching about sexual matters in Church settings?
answers: Teach doctrine and standards in an appropriate, modest, and age-appropriate way; avoid explicit or graphic details
Provide detailed sexual instruction so youth are fully informed
Refer all questions to online sources rather than addressing them
Avoid the topic entirely to prevent discomfort
correct_answer: Teach doctrine and standards in an appropriate, modest, and age-appropriate way; avoid explicit or graphic details
explanation: The General Handbook directs leaders to teach standards clearly while avoiding explicit or graphic content and tailoring instruction appropriately for age and setting.

question_text: According to LDS scripture, at what age does a child become accountable before God and thus capable of sin, making baptism appropriate?
answers: 8 years old
12 years old
At birth
18 years old
correct_answer: 8 years old
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 68:27 sets the age of accountability and baptism at eight; Moroni 8 teaches that little children are not capable of committing sin.

question_text: According to the Second Article of Faith, who will be punished for sin?
answers: Each person for their own sins, not for Adam's transgression
All people for Adam and Eve's original sin
Only those who never hear the gospel
Only those who break civil law
correct_answer: Each person for their own sins, not for Adam's transgression
explanation: Article of Faith 2 states: "We believe that men will be punished for their own sins, and not for Adam’s transgression."

question_text: In LDS teachings, what is the primary spiritual consequence of committing sin?
answers: Separation from God (spiritual death)
Immediate loss of agency
Physical mortality
Automatic excommunication from the Church
correct_answer: Separation from God (spiritual death)
explanation: Scripture teaches that sin causes spiritual death, or separation from God’s presence (e.g., Alma 42:9; 3 Nephi 27:19; D&C 1:31).

topic: Single Adult Members of the Church
question_text: In the Church’s General Handbook, what age range defines Young Single Adults (YSA)?
explanation: The General Handbook defines young single adults as members ages 18 through 30.

topic: Single Adult Members of the Church
question_text: According to official policy, which statement best describes where young single adults may attend Sunday worship?
answers: They may choose to attend either a YSA unit (where available) or their geographic home unit; their membership record should be in the unit they attend.
They are required to attend a YSA unit if one exists in their area.
They must remain in their geographic home ward until age 31.
They may only attend institute, not regular Sunday worship, if they are YSA.
correct_answer: They may choose to attend either a YSA unit (where available) or their geographic home unit; their membership record should be in the unit they attend.
explanation: The General Handbook states YSAs may choose to attend a YSA unit or their home ward; membership records are kept in the unit they attend.

topic: Single Adult Members of the Church
question_text: How does the General Handbook define 'single adults' (as distinct from YSA)?
answers: Members age 31 and older who are not married.
Any member 18 and older who is not married.
Members 21 and older who have never married.
Members 31–45 who are divorced.
correct_answer: Members age 31 and older who are not married.
explanation: Official policy distinguishes young single adults (18–30) from single adults, who are 31 and older and not married.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 83, who has a claim on the Church for maintenance and support when needed?
answers: Widows and their children (the fatherless)
Only full-tithe payers
Only those serving full-time missions
Only members with current temple recommends
correct_answer: Widows and their children (the fatherless)
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 83 teaches that widows and orphans have a claim upon the Church for their maintenance and support.

question_text: In The Family: A Proclamation to the World, what guidance is given when circumstances such as death or disability result in a single-parent household?
answers: Families should make individual adaptations, with extended family encouraged to help
Single-parent families are asked to refrain from holding Church callings
Children in single-parent homes should delay baptism until age 18
Single parents are excluded from temple attendance
correct_answer: Families should make individual adaptations, with extended family encouraged to help
explanation: The Proclamation states that disability, death, or other circumstances may necessitate individual adaptation, and that extended families should lend support when needed.

question_text: According to the General Handbook, who in the ward has the primary responsibility to care for the poor and needy, including coordinating assistance for single-parent families?
answers: The bishop
The stake president
The Relief Society president acting independently
The Sunday School president
correct_answer: The bishop
explanation: The General Handbook states the bishop holds primary responsibility for the temporal welfare of members and coordinates assistance through the ward council.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 88:15, what is the definition of the 'soul of man'?
answers: The spirit and the body together
The immortal mind alone
The physical body without a spirit
The collective human family
correct_answer: The spirit and the body together
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 88:15 states, "the spirit and the body are the soul of man."

question_text: What does Doctrine and Covenants 18:10 teach about the worth of souls?
answers: Their worth is great in the sight of God
Their worth is equal to that of sparrows
Their worth depends on church membership
Their worth is unknowable
correct_answer: Their worth is great in the sight of God
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 18:10 teaches, "Remember the worth of souls is great in the sight of God."

question_text: In LDS scripture, what happens to the soul at the Resurrection?
answers: The spirit and body are reunited in a perfected, immortal state, never to be divided
The soul dissolves into the universe
The spirit takes on a new mortal body for another lifetime
The body remains in the grave while the spirit becomes a disembodied ghost
correct_answer: The spirit and body are reunited in a perfected, immortal state, never to be divided
explanation: Alma 11:45 and Alma 40:23 teach that the spirit and body are restored to their perfect frame, never to be divided again.

question_text: In 1884, where was the document known as the "Spaulding Manuscript" rediscovered?
answers: Among L. L. Rice's papers in Honolulu, Hawaii
In the Kirtland Temple archives in Ohio
In the Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
Buried near the Hill Cumorah in New York
correct_answer: Among L. L. Rice's papers in Honolulu, Hawaii
explanation: The manuscript was found in 1884 among the papers of L. L. Rice in Honolulu and examined with James H. Fairchild of Oberlin College.

question_text: After examining the rediscovered Spaulding manuscript in 1884, what did Oberlin College president James H. Fairchild report about its relation to the Book of Mormon?
answers: That it bore no resemblance and was not the source of the Book of Mormon
That it matched large portions of the Book of Mormon verbatim
That only the names in the Book of Mormon were borrowed from it
That the manuscript itself was a later forgery created after 1830
correct_answer: That it bore no resemblance and was not the source of the Book of Mormon
explanation: Fairchild publicly stated that the manuscript did not resemble the Book of Mormon and could not have served as its source.

question_text: Which 1834 publication first popularized the claim that the Book of Mormon derived from a lost Spaulding manuscript?
answers: E. D. Howe's "Mormonism Unvailed"
Times and Seasons
Joseph Smith's "Wentworth Letter"
Orson Pratt's "An Interesting Account of Several Remarkable Visions"
correct_answer: E. D. Howe's "Mormonism Unvailed"
explanation: E. D. Howe's 1834 book presented affidavits and arguments promoting the Spaulding theory, becoming the main early vehicle for that claim.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 130:22, what is the nature of the Holy Ghost?
answers: He is a personage of spirit and does not have a body of flesh and bone
He is an impersonal force that fills the universe
He is the resurrected spirit of Adam
He is identical in substance with the Father and Son, sharing one bodily form
correct_answer: He is a personage of spirit and does not have a body of flesh and bone
explanation: D&C 130:22 teaches that the Holy Ghost is a personage of Spirit, unlike the Father and the Son who have bodies of flesh and bone.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 88:15, what constitutes the 'soul of man'?
answers: The spirit and the body together
The spirit alone
The body animated by breath
The mind and heart united
correct_answer: The spirit and the body together
explanation: D&C 88:15 states plainly that the spirit and the body together are the soul of man.

question_text: Which statement accurately describes the Light of Christ (also called the Spirit of Christ) in Latter-day Saint doctrine?
answers: It is the divine influence that gives light to every person and can lead them to the gospel
It is the special gift conferred only after baptism by laying on of hands
It is a premortal spirit sibling assigned to each person as a guardian
It is another name for the Holy Ghost, the third member of the Godhead
correct_answer: It is the divine influence that gives light to every person and can lead them to the gospel
explanation: Moroni 7:16 and D&C 84:46 teach that the Spirit (Light) of Christ is given to every person to know good from evil and to enlighten all.

question_text: According to The Family: A Proclamation to the World, who are considered spirit sons or daughters of Heavenly Parents?
answers: All human beings, male and female
Only those who have received baptism
Only members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
Only the righteous who keep the commandments
correct_answer: All human beings, male and female
explanation: The Proclamation states that "All human beings—male and female—... each is a beloved spirit son or daughter of heavenly parents."

question_text: Which scripture explicitly refers to God as the "Father of spirits," supporting the belief that humans are His spirit children?
answers: Hebrews 12:9
John 3:16
Alma 32:21
Doctrine and Covenants 20:77
correct_answer: Hebrews 12:9
explanation: Hebrews 12:9 uses the phrase "Father of spirits," aligning with the doctrine that humans are spirit children of God.

question_text: In Latter-day Saint doctrine, when did individuals exist as spirit children of Heavenly Parents in relation to mortal life?
answers: Before mortal birth in a premortal existence
Only beginning at mortal conception
Not until after resurrection
It is unknown and not taught
correct_answer: Before mortal birth in a premortal existence
explanation: LDS scripture teaches a premortal life (e.g., Abraham 3:22–23; Jeremiah 1:5), and official teachings affirm that we are spirit children of Heavenly Parents prior to birth.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 9:8–9, how does the Lord indicate a spiritual confirmation when something is right?
answers: You will feel that it is right, often described as a 'burning in the bosom'
You will hear an audible voice declaring the truth
You will see a visible sign from heaven
Your body will shake uncontrollably
correct_answer: You will feel that it is right, often described as a 'burning in the bosom'
explanation: D&C 9:8–9 teaches to study it out and ask; if it is right, the Lord will cause your bosom to burn and you will feel that it is right; if wrong, you will have a stupor of thought.

question_text: According to Moroni 10:4–5, what conditions should a person meet to receive a witness of the Book of Mormon's truth by the power of the Holy Ghost?
answers: Ask God with a sincere heart, with real intent, having faith in Christ
Perform a specific ritual fast of forty days
Rely solely on academic analysis and historical evidence
Repeat a prescribed prayer exactly as written
correct_answer: Ask God with a sincere heart, with real intent, having faith in Christ
explanation: Moroni 10:4–5 states that those who ask God with a sincere heart, real intent, and faith in Christ will have the truth manifested to them by the power of the Holy Ghost.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 8:2–3, where does the Holy Ghost communicate revelation to individuals?
answers: In their mind and in their heart
Only through dreams while sleeping
Through the audible voice of angels
By writing messages in the heavens
correct_answer: In their mind and in their heart
explanation: D&C 8:2–3 declares, 'I will tell you in your mind and in your heart, by the Holy Ghost,' describing the Spirit of revelation.

question_text: Which Article of Faith specifically affirms belief in spiritual gifts such as tongues, prophecy, revelation, visions, healing, and interpretation of tongues?
answers: Third Article of Faith
Seventh Article of Faith
Tenth Article of Faith
Thirteenth Article of Faith
correct_answer: Seventh Article of Faith
explanation: The Seventh Article of Faith states that Latter-day Saints believe in gifts such as tongues, prophecy, revelation, visions, healing, and interpretation of tongues.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 46, what counsel is given about seeking spiritual gifts?
answers: Seek earnestly the best gifts, remembering they are given for the benefit of those who love God
Do not seek spiritual gifts; they will come automatically if needed
Spiritual gifts are reserved only for those holding priesthood office
Spiritual gifts should be used to draw attention to oneself as a sign of holiness
correct_answer: Seek earnestly the best gifts, remembering they are given for the benefit of those who love God
explanation: D&C 46:8–9, 26 counsels members to seek earnestly the best gifts and teaches they are given for the benefit and profit of God’s children.

question_text: According to Moroni 10 in the Book of Mormon, what is taught about the continuance of spiritual gifts?
answers: They will never be done away as long as the world stands, except due to unbelief
They ceased with the deaths of the New Testament apostles
They are bestowed only upon the House of Israel until Christ’s Second Coming
They are primarily evidence of a person’s salvation compared to others
correct_answer: They will never be done away as long as the world stands, except due to unbelief
explanation: Moroni 10:19–21 teaches that spiritual gifts remain among God’s people and are only withheld when there is unbelief.

question_text: According to Alma 40:11–14 in the Book of Mormon, what is the condition of the spirits of all people immediately after death?
answers: They are taken home to God and enter a state of happiness (paradise) or misery (spirit prison) to await the resurrection
They sleep in unconsciousness until the Final Judgment
They are immediately resurrected and judged
They reincarnate into another mortal life
correct_answer: They are taken home to God and enter a state of happiness (paradise) or misery (spirit prison) to await the resurrection
explanation: Alma 40:11–14 teaches that spirits go to a state of paradise or prison after death and remain there until the time of the resurrection.

question_text: In Doctrine and Covenants 138, how did the Savior provide for the preaching of the gospel to spirits in prison following His death?
answers: He appointed and sent authorized messengers from among the righteous in paradise to teach them
He personally went among the wicked in spirit prison to preach to them directly
He delayed all preaching to the dead until after His Resurrection
He ended the possibility of repentance after death
correct_answer: He appointed and sent authorized messengers from among the righteous in paradise to teach them
explanation: D&C 138 explains that Christ visited the righteous and organized messengers to carry the gospel to spirits in prison; He did not personally go among the wicked.

question_text: What is the primary purpose of the spirit world in Latter-day Saint doctrine?
answers: To await the resurrection while receiving continued instruction and, for some, the opportunity to accept the gospel
To determine one's final eternal glory and make permanent assignments
To forget mortal life and begin a new mortal probation
To permanently separate families until the Final Judgment
correct_answer: To await the resurrection while receiving continued instruction and, for some, the opportunity to accept the gospel
explanation: Scriptures and official teachings (e.g., Alma 40; D&C 138; Gospel Topics) describe the spirit world as a place of waiting and learning where the gospel is preached to those who did not receive it in mortality.

question_text: In the organizational structure of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, what is a "stake"?
answers: A group of wards and branches within a defined geographic area
A missionary training center district
A single large ward led by multiple bishops
A regional office presided over by an Area Presidency
correct_answer: A group of wards and branches within a defined geographic area
explanation: A stake is an administrative unit made up of multiple congregations (wards and branches) in a geographic area, as described in the Church’s General Handbook (Stake Organization).

question_text: According to revealed pattern and current Church governance, how many high councilors make up a stake high council?
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 102 establishes a high council to consist of twelve, and the General Handbook specifies a stake high council includes 12 high councilors.

question_text: How often are stake conferences held in each stake of the Church?
answers: Twice each year
Once each year
Four times each year
Monthly
correct_answer: Twice each year
explanation: The General Handbook states that stake conferences are held semiannually (twice each year).

question_text: Which volumes comprise the Standard Works of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in English?
answers: The Holy Bible (King James Version), the Book of Mormon, the Doctrine and Covenants, and the Pearl of Great Price
The Holy Bible (NIV), the Book of Mormon, Journal of Discourses, and the Pearl of Great Price
The Apocrypha, the Book of Mormon, the Doctrine and Covenants, and the Pearl of Great Price
The Holy Bible (KJV), the Book of Mormon, the Doctrine and Covenants, and Lectures on Faith
correct_answer: The Holy Bible (King James Version), the Book of Mormon, the Doctrine and Covenants, and the Pearl of Great Price
explanation: The LDS Standard Works consist of four volumes: the Holy Bible (KJV in English), the Book of Mormon, the Doctrine and Covenants, and the Pearl of Great Price, as listed in official Church publications and scripture headers.

question_text: In English, which edition of the Bible is included in the LDS Standard Works?
answers: King James Version (KJV)
New King James Version (NKJV)
New International Version (NIV)
New Revised Standard Version (NRSV)
correct_answer: King James Version (KJV)
explanation: The Church uses the King James Version in English as part of its standard works, as stated in official Church resources and scripture editions.

question_text: Within the Standard Works, where are the Articles of Faith found?
answers: Pearl of Great Price
Doctrine and Covenants
Book of Mormon
New Testament
correct_answer: Pearl of Great Price
explanation: The Articles of Faith are one of the constituent texts of the Pearl of Great Price, as shown in the official table of contents of that volume.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 59:18–20, how should Latter-day Saints use the things of the earth?
answers: With judgment, not to excess or extortion
Without restraint, since all things are given freely
Only for basic survival needs, avoiding enjoyment
Only after consecrating everything to Church leaders
correct_answer: With judgment, not to excess or extortion
explanation: D&C 59:18–20 teaches that the things of the earth are for the benefit and use of man to please the eye and gladden the heart, and are to be used with judgment, not to excess or extortion.

question_text: Which stewardship principle is taught in Doctrine and Covenants 72:3–4?
answers: Every steward must render an account of his stewardship, in time and in eternity
Stewards are accountable only to their own conscience
Stewards should avoid temporal responsibilities and focus solely on spiritual matters
Bishops hold all stewardships personally and do not delegate
correct_answer: Every steward must render an account of his stewardship, in time and in eternity
explanation: D&C 72:3–4 states it is required of the Lord that every steward render an account of their stewardship both in time and in eternity.

question_text: Under the law of consecration revealed in Doctrine and Covenants 51, on what basis were stewardships to be appointed?
answers: According to each person's family, circumstances, wants, and needs
Equally by giving identical portions to everyone regardless of situation
Based solely on priesthood office
Based on length of Church membership
correct_answer: According to each person's family, circumstances, wants, and needs
explanation: D&C 51:3 directs that portions (stewardships) be appointed "every man equal according to his family, according to his circumstances and his wants and his needs."

question_text: According to official Church teachings, how is the eternal accountability of a person who dies by suicide understood?
answers: Only God knows the circumstances and will judge; factors like mental illness can diminish accountability
The person is automatically denied resurrection
They have committed the unpardonable sin and cannot be forgiven
They must be posthumously excommunicated
correct_answer: Only God knows the circumstances and will judge; factors like mental illness can diminish accountability
explanation: Official Church sources teach that only God can judge those who die by suicide and that mental illness or extreme distress may reduce accountability.

question_text: What is the Church’s policy regarding holding a funeral in a meetinghouse for someone who died by suicide?
answers: It is permitted under the bishop’s direction; services should be compassionate and avoid pronouncing the person’s eternal destiny
It is not permitted in any Church facility
It requires First Presidency approval
It is allowed only if the death occurred outside the ward boundaries
correct_answer: It is permitted under the bishop’s direction; services should be compassionate and avoid pronouncing the person’s eternal destiny
explanation: The General Handbook allows funerals for those who die by suicide and counsels sensitivity while avoiding judgments about the person’s eternal state.

question_text: When a member expresses suicidal thoughts or intent, what do official Church resources counsel leaders and members to do first?
answers: Take the concern seriously, ensure the person’s immediate safety, and seek immediate professional help (including emergency services)
Advise the person to pray and wait for feelings to pass
Keep the matter confidential and avoid involving professionals
Begin Church disciplinary proceedings
correct_answer: Take the concern seriously, ensure the person’s immediate safety, and seek immediate professional help (including emergency services)
explanation: The General Handbook and Church Life Help materials direct leaders and members to treat threats seriously, secure immediate safety, and obtain professional/medical help without delay.

question_text: According to the Church's official Gospel Topics entry on tattoos, what is the Church's general counsel regarding getting tattoos?
answers: The Church discourages tattoos.
Tattoos are acceptable as long as they are modest and faith-based.
Tattoos are required for some callings.
Tattoos automatically disqualify a person from full fellowship.
correct_answer: The Church discourages tattoos.
explanation: The Gospel Topics entry "Tattoos" teaches that the Church discourages tattoos and emphasizes treating the body as sacred.

question_text: Under the current Missionary Standards for Disciples of Jesus Christ, what is the policy on earrings for missionaries?
answers: Elders do not wear earrings; sister missionaries may wear one pair of simple earrings.
Both elders and sisters may wear multiple earrings.
Elders may wear one stud earring; sisters may wear up to three pairs.
Earrings are prohibited for all missionaries.
correct_answer: Elders do not wear earrings; sister missionaries may wear one pair of simple earrings.
explanation: The Missionary Standards state that elders should not wear earrings, while sister missionaries may wear one pair of simple earrings.

question_text: In his September 2000 address "Great Shall Be the Peace of Thy Children," what counsel did President Gordon B. Hinckley give regarding body piercing?
answers: He discouraged tattoos and body piercings and counseled women to wear only one pair of earrings.
He encouraged multiple ear piercings as a form of cultural expression.
He taught that body piercing is acceptable if done for fashion.
He gave no counsel on tattoos or piercings in that address.
correct_answer: He discouraged tattoos and body piercings and counseled women to wear only one pair of earrings.
explanation: In that General Relief Society meeting address, President Hinckley specifically discouraged tattoos and body piercing and asked women to wear only one pair of earrings.

question_text: According to the Doctrine and Covenants, what is the maximum number of members in a Teachers Quorum?
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 107 specifies quorum sizes; verse 86 sets the Teachers Quorum at up to 24 members.

question_text: Which of the following is explicitly listed as a duty of a Teacher in the Aaronic Priesthood?
answers: Watch over the Church and be with and strengthen members
Baptize by immersion
Bless the sacrament
Confer the gift of the Holy Ghost
correct_answer: Watch over the Church and be with and strengthen members
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 20:53–55 lists the Teacher’s duties, including to watch over the Church and strengthen members; Teachers do not baptize, bless the sacrament, or confer the Holy Ghost.

question_text: Which action related to the sacrament is a Teacher authorized to perform?
answers: Prepare the sacrament
Bless the sacrament
Consecrate oil for anointing the sick
Confirm new members
correct_answer: Prepare the sacrament
explanation: According to the General Handbook, Teachers may prepare (and help pass) the sacrament; only Priests bless it, and Melchizedek Priesthood holders confirm and consecrate oil. D&C 20 also notes Teachers do not administer the sacrament by prayer.

question_text: According to Teaching in the Savior's Way, who is the 'true teacher' in gospel learning and teaching?
answers: The Holy Ghost
The called instructor
The class presidency
The bishopric
correct_answer: The Holy Ghost
explanation: Official Church teaching materials emphasize that the Holy Ghost is the true teacher; instructors help learners invite His influence.

question_text: According to the General Handbook, what primary resources should Church teachers use when preparing lessons?
answers: The scriptures, teachings of living prophets, and Church-produced curriculum (such as Come, Follow Me)
Any uplifting online content from trusted influencers
Non-Church manuals selected by the teacher
Locally created lesson materials approved only by the ward council
correct_answer: The scriptures, teachings of living prophets, and Church-produced curriculum (such as Come, Follow Me)
explanation: The General Handbook directs teachers to use the scriptures, the words of latter-day prophets, and approved Church curriculum as primary resources.

question_text: According to Preach My Gospel, what are essential elements of extending an invitation to act (a commitment)?
answers: Invite to act, promise blessings, testify, and follow up
Assign reading, avoid promises, and do not follow up
Give background, ask for a decision, then move on without follow-up
Keep it open-ended and rely on class participation only
correct_answer: Invite to act, promise blessings, testify, and follow up
explanation: Preach My Gospel teaches to invite people to act, promise blessings, bear testimony, and then follow up to help them keep commitments.

question_text: In Latter-day Saint doctrine, the telestial kingdom's glory is compared to which heavenly body?
answers: The sun
The moon
The stars
No light
correct_answer: The stars
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 76:81 compares the telestial glory to the glory of the stars (cf. 1 Corinthians 15:41).

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 76, which group is described as inheriting the telestial kingdom?
answers: Those who receive the testimony of Jesus, are baptized, and keep the commandments
Honorable people who were blinded by the craftiness of men
Those who received not the gospel nor the testimony of Jesus, including liars, sorcerers, adulterers, and whoremongers
Those who deny the Holy Ghost after receiving it
correct_answer: Those who received not the gospel nor the testimony of Jesus, including liars, sorcerers, adulterers, and whoremongers
explanation: D&C 76:82–103 states that the telestial are those who received not the gospel nor the testimony of Jesus and includes liars, sorcerers, adulterers, whoremongers, and those who love and make a lie.

question_text: Per Doctrine and Covenants 76:86–88, from whom do those in the telestial kingdom receive ministration?
answers: From the terrestrial and from administering angels appointed to minister for them
Directly and personally from the Father
From inhabitants of the telestial only; no other ministrations occur
They minister to the celestial and terrestrial
correct_answer: From the terrestrial and from administering angels appointed to minister for them
explanation: D&C 76:86–88 teaches the telestial receive of the Holy Spirit through the ministration of the terrestrial and also of administering angels appointed to minister for them.

question_text: Which ordinance performed in Latter-day Saint temples offers the opportunity for deceased persons to receive the ordinance by proxy?
answers: Baptism for the dead
Weekly sacrament
Baby blessing
Tithing settlement
correct_answer: Baptism for the dead
explanation: Temples are used to perform saving ordinances for both the living and the dead, including baptism for the dead as taught in Doctrine and Covenants 124 and 128.

question_text: After a temple is dedicated, who is permitted to enter to participate in ordinances?
answers: Members of the Church who hold a current temple recommend
Any respectful visitor regardless of religion
Only full-time missionaries
Only members who have served a mission
correct_answer: Members of the Church who hold a current temple recommend
explanation: Following dedication, access to Latter-day Saint temples is limited to members who hold a valid temple recommend, per the Church’s official policies and handbook.

question_text: What was the first temple constructed and dedicated by the Church in this dispensation?
answers: Kirtland Temple (1836), Kirtland, Ohio
Nauvoo Temple (1846), Nauvoo, Illinois
St. George Utah Temple (1877), St. George, Utah
Salt Lake Temple (1893), Salt Lake City, Utah
correct_answer: Kirtland Temple (1836), Kirtland, Ohio
explanation: The Kirtland Temple, dedicated in 1836, was the first temple built by the Church in the latter days; its dedicatory prayer is recorded in Doctrine and Covenants 109.

question_text: According to James 1:13 in the LDS edition of the Bible, which statement correctly describes God's relationship to temptation?
answers: God tempteth no man with evil.
God occasionally tempts people to refine them.
God tempts the disobedient but spares the righteous.
God created temptation to compel obedience.
correct_answer: God tempteth no man with evil.
explanation: James 1:13 teaches that God "cannot be tempted with evil, neither tempteth he any man."

question_text: Which scripture passage explicitly teaches that God provides "a way to escape" temptation so we are not tempted above what we are able?
answers: 1 Corinthians 10:13
Alma 34:32
Doctrine and Covenants 89:18–21
Moses 1:39
correct_answer: 1 Corinthians 10:13
explanation: Paul writes that God is faithful and will not suffer us to be tempted above what we are able, but will with the temptation also make a way to escape.

question_text: In 3 Nephi 18:15, what counsel did Jesus give to help disciples avoid entering into temptation?
answers: Watch and pray always
Rely solely on personal willpower
Seek after signs and wonders
Separate from all nonbelievers
correct_answer: Watch and pray always
explanation: Jesus counseled, "Watch and pray always, lest ye enter into temptation" (3 Nephi 18:15).

question_text: Which two chapters of the Bible contain the full text of the Ten Commandments?
answers: Exodus 20 and Deuteronomy 5
Genesis 1 and Exodus 12
Leviticus 19 and Numbers 14
Deuteronomy 4 and Joshua 24
correct_answer: Exodus 20 and Deuteronomy 5
explanation: The Ten Commandments (Decalogue) are first given in Exodus 20:2–17 and repeated in Deuteronomy 5:6–21.

question_text: In the Book of Mormon, which prophet recited the Ten Commandments to King Noah’s priests?
answers: Abinadi
Nephi
Alma the Younger
Samuel the Lamanite
correct_answer: Abinadi
explanation: Abinadi quotes and teaches the Ten Commandments in Mosiah 12–13 (e.g., Mosiah 12:33–36; 13:12–24).

question_text: Which section of the Doctrine and Covenants gives latter-day instruction on Sabbath observance consistent with the Fourth Commandment?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 59
Doctrine and Covenants 76
Doctrine and Covenants 89
Doctrine and Covenants 134
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 59
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 59:9–14 directs Sabbath worship and refraining from worldly labors, aligning with the Fourth Commandment.

question_text: In Latter-day Saint scripture, the terrestrial kingdom's glory is compared to which heavenly body?
answers: The moon
The sun
The stars
The earth
correct_answer: The moon
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 76 teaches that the terrestrial glory differs from the celestial as the moon differs from the sun (see D&C 76:78; cf. 1 Corinthians 15:40–41).

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 76, which group best describes those who inherit the terrestrial kingdom?
answers: Honorable people who were not valiant in the testimony of Jesus, and those who did not receive His testimony in mortality but accepted it afterward
Those who deny the Holy Ghost after having received it
Those who receive the fulness of the Father and are exalted
Liars, sorcerers, and adulterers who are thrust down to hell before inheriting glory
correct_answer: Honorable people who were not valiant in the testimony of Jesus, and those who did not receive His testimony in mortality but accepted it afterward
explanation: D&C 76:72–75, 79 describes terrestrial heirs as honorable people not valiant in the testimony of Jesus and those who receive His testimony after mortality.

question_text: What divine presence do inhabitants of the terrestrial kingdom receive, according to D&C 76?
answers: The presence of the Son, but not the fulness of the Father
The fulness of the Father and the Son
No presence of either the Father or the Son
Only the ministration of angels from the telestial kingdom
correct_answer: The presence of the Son, but not the fulness of the Father
explanation: D&C 76:77 states that terrestrial heirs receive the presence of the Son but not the fulness of the Father.

question_text: According to Moroni 10:4–5, by what means may a person know the truth of the Book of Mormon and gain a testimony of it?
answers: By the power of the Holy Ghost
By priesthood interviews
By majority vote of the congregation
