By seeing the gold plates in person
correct_answer: By the power of the Holy Ghost
explanation: Moroni teaches that after asking God in faith, truth is made known by the power of the Holy Ghost (Moroni 10:4–5).

question_text: Which Latter-day Saint meeting is designated for members to share brief personal testimonies, typically held on the first Sunday of the month?
answers: Fast and testimony meeting
Bishopric youth discussion
Stake conference
Ward council
correct_answer: Fast and testimony meeting
explanation: The General Handbook designates fast and testimony meeting, usually on the first Sunday, for members to bear brief, heartfelt testimonies.

question_text: In Doctrine and Covenants 46:13–14, which spiritual gift directly relates to bearing testimony of Jesus Christ?
answers: To know that Jesus Christ is the Son of God
To speak with tongues
To work miracles
To have faith to be healed
correct_answer: To know that Jesus Christ is the Son of God
explanation: D&C 46:13–14 specifies the gift to know that Jesus is the Son of God and the gift to believe on others’ words, both related to testimony.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 119, how is tithing defined?
answers: One-tenth of all their 'interest' (income) annually
One-twelfth of gross income monthly
A voluntary donation with no set amount
Ten percent of net income after taxes only
correct_answer: One-tenth of all their 'interest' (income) annually
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 119:4 defines tithing as "one-tenth of all their interest annually."

question_text: In official Church policy, who determines what constitutes a full tithe and declares a member’s tithing status?
answers: The member, in personal accountability to the Lord
The bishop, after reviewing income documents
The ward council, by common consent
The area presidency, using standardized income guidelines
correct_answer: The member, in personal accountability to the Lord
explanation: The General Handbook teaches that members decide what constitutes a full tithe for them and declare their status; leaders do not define the base or verify income.

question_text: When and where was the revelation establishing tithing as a standing law in this dispensation received?
answers: July 1838, Far West, Missouri
April 1830, Fayette, New York
February 1833, Kirtland, Ohio
January 1841, Nauvoo, Illinois
correct_answer: July 1838, Far West, Missouri
explanation: The section heading to Doctrine and Covenants 119 identifies July 8, 1838, in Far West, Missouri, as the date and place.

question_text: According to 'The Family: A Proclamation to the World,' which statement best reflects the Church’s doctrinal teaching about gender?
answers: Gender is an essential characteristic of individual premortal, mortal, and eternal identity and purpose.
Gender is a social construct that varies by culture and time.
Gender is determined by personal choice after baptism.
The Church has no official teaching about gender.
correct_answer: Answer A
explanation: The Proclamation states that gender is an essential characteristic of individual premortal, mortal, and eternal identity and purpose.

question_text: According to the General Handbook, does the Church change the sex listed on a member’s official membership record to reflect a gender identity different from sex at birth?
answers: No; the sex on membership records is based on biological sex at birth and is not changed to reflect gender identity.
Yes; it is changed upon presentation of a legal document.
Yes; local bishops may change it at their discretion.
It is changed only if the member receives a temple recommend.
correct_answer: Answer A
explanation: The General Handbook states that membership records use sex at birth and are not changed to match a self-identified gender.

question_text: What is the Church’s official position on the causes of feelings of gender dysphoria?
answers: The Church does not take a position on the causes of gender dysphoria.
It is exclusively caused by social influence.
It is exclusively caused by sin and can be repented of.
It is exclusively genetic and predetermined.
correct_answer: Answer A
explanation: Official Church materials state the Church does not take a position on the causes of gender dysphoria.

question_text: According to the second Article of Faith, how does LDS doctrine describe responsibility for Adam's transgression?
answers: People inherit guilt for Adam's transgression and are punished for it.
People are punished for their own sins, not for Adam's transgression.
Only baptized members are freed from Adam's transgression.
Adam's transgression ended agency for his posterity.
correct_answer: People are punished for their own sins, not for Adam's transgression.
explanation: Article of Faith 2 teaches: "We believe that men will be punished for their own sins, and not for Adam’s transgression."

question_text: In LDS scripture, Adam and Eve’s act of eating the forbidden fruit is most accurately described as what?
answers: A transgression enabling the Fall and mortality
An unforgivable sin
A violation that permanently separated humanity from God without remedy
A ceremonial ordinance
correct_answer: A transgression enabling the Fall and mortality
explanation: Scriptures such as 2 Nephi 2 and Moses 5–6 refer to the Fall as resulting from Adam and Eve’s "transgression," which introduced mortality and the opportunity for joy and progression.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 58:42–43, which actions are necessary to obtain forgiveness after transgression?
answers: Confess and forsake the sin
Publicly announce the sin in sacrament meeting
Pay restitution without confession
Perform a set number of good works
correct_answer: Confess and forsake the sin
explanation: D&C 58:42–43 teaches that those who repent are forgiven, and that repentance is known because they "confess" and "forsake" their sins.

topic: Translation and Historicity of the Book of Abraham
question_text: In what year were fragments of the Joseph Smith Papyri associated with the Book of Abraham rediscovered and presented to The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints?
explanation: In 1967, the Metropolitan Museum of Art transferred several papyrus fragments to the Church; these had been thought lost in the 1871 Chicago Fire.

topic: Translation and Historicity of the Book of Abraham
question_text: According to the Church's Gospel Topics essay, what do the surviving papyrus fragments primarily contain?
answers: Egyptian funerary texts such as the Book of Breathings and portions of the Book of the Dead
An ancient Hebrew manuscript authored by Abraham
An excerpt from the golden plates
An early Christian Coptic gospel
correct_answer: Egyptian funerary texts such as the Book of Breathings and portions of the Book of the Dead
explanation: The extant fragments are late-period Egyptian funerary texts, not a narrative authored by Abraham.

topic: Translation and Historicity of the Book of Abraham
question_text: Which explanation is identified in the Church's Gospel Topics essay as a plausible way Joseph Smith produced the Book of Abraham?
answers: The papyri served as a catalyst for revelation rather than a direct, word-for-word translation of the surviving fragments
Professional Egyptologists of the 1830s provided a full scholarly translation for Joseph Smith
It was written by later Church leaders after Joseph Smith's death and retroactively attributed to him
Joseph Smith translated the extant Book of Breathings fragments directly into the Book of Abraham
correct_answer: The papyri served as a catalyst for revelation rather than a direct, word-for-word translation of the surviving fragments
explanation: The essay outlines plausible scenarios, including that the papyri acted as a catalyst for revelation; it does not claim a direct translation of the extant fragments or later authorship.

question_text: In what year did The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints begin publishing the Gospel Topics Essays online to provide accurate information and historical context on challenging topics?
explanation: The Church began posting the Gospel Topics Essays on its official website in 2013 to offer accurate, contextual information on historical and doctrinal subjects.

question_text: Which official publishing imprint of the Church History Department publishes the Joseph Smith Papers, providing public access to primary documents with transcripts and images?
answers: Deseret Book
Church Historian's Press
BYU Studies Quarterly
Neal A. Maxwell Institute Press
correct_answer: Church Historian's Press
explanation: The Joseph Smith Papers are published by the Church Historian's Press, an imprint of the Church History Department dedicated to making primary sources widely available.

question_text: What is the stated purpose of the Church’s "Saints" narrative history series, which began in 2018 with Saints: The Standard of Truth?
answers: To present a transparent, well-documented, and readable narrative history for Latter-day Saints
To replace all previous Church history manuals with a single academic textbook
To compile only faith-promoting stories without citations
To provide speculative theories about historical events
correct_answer: To present a transparent, well-documented, and readable narrative history for Latter-day Saints
explanation: The "Saints" series is an officially sponsored, well-sourced narrative history designed to be accurate, candid, and accessible to general readers.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 93:24, how is 'truth' defined?
answers: Knowledge of things as they are, and as they were, and as they are to come
Whatever the majority believes
Any statement that feels right to an individual
Only scientifically verified facts
correct_answer: Knowledge of things as they are, and as they were, and as they are to come
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 93:24 explicitly defines truth as knowledge of things as they are, as they were, and as they are to come.

question_text: Which scripture teaches that 'by the power of the Holy Ghost ye may know the truth of all things'?
answers: Moroni 10:5
Alma 32:21
Joseph Smith—History 1:17
Articles of Faith 1:5
correct_answer: Moroni 10:5
explanation: Moroni 10:5 states that by the power of the Holy Ghost we may know the truth of all things.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 84:45, what is declared to be 'truth'?
answers: The word of the Lord
The philosophies of men
The traditions of the fathers
The opinions of prophets
correct_answer: The word of the Lord
explanation: Doctrine and Covenants 84:45 teaches, 'For the word of the Lord is truth.'

question_text: Which Latter-day Saint scripture contains the directive 'be one; and if ye are not one ye are not mine'?
answers: Doctrine and Covenants 38:27
Mosiah 18:21
John 17:21
Alma 1:25
correct_answer: Doctrine and Covenants 38:27
explanation: D&C 38:27 records the Lord’s command to be one, explicitly tying discipleship to unity.

question_text: According to Moses 7:18, how is Zion described?
answers: A people of one heart and one mind who dwelt in righteousness, with no poor among them
A people gathered at the Red Sea after leaving Egypt
The kingdom of King Benjamin that enjoyed peace for forty years
A walled city whose defenses fell after seven days of marching
correct_answer: A people of one heart and one mind who dwelt in righteousness, with no poor among them
explanation: Moses 7:18 states that the Lord called His people Zion because they were of one heart and one mind, dwelt in righteousness, and had no poor among them.

question_text: According to 3 Nephi 11:29–30, what did the resurrected Jesus teach about contention among His people?
answers: Contention is not of Him, and there should be no disputations regarding His doctrine
Healthy debate is encouraged to refine understanding of truth
Only apostles may contend over doctrine
Contention is acceptable if it defends tradition
correct_answer: Contention is not of Him, and there should be no disputations regarding His doctrine
explanation: In 3 Nephi 11:29–30, Jesus declares that contention is of the devil and commands that there be no disputations concerning His doctrine.

question_text: According to the Church's General Handbook, what counsel is given when a pregnancy occurs outside of marriage?
answers: Leaders provide loving support while the parents prayerfully consider options—including marriage (if appropriate), single parenting, or placing the child for adoption; the decision rests with the parents
Adoption is required in all cases of unwed pregnancy
Local leaders determine whether the couple must marry or place the child for adoption
The Church forbids adoption and requires single parenting
correct_answer: Leaders provide loving support while the parents prayerfully consider options—including marriage (if appropriate), single parenting, or placing the child for adoption; the decision rests with the parents
explanation: The General Handbook instructs leaders to minister with compassion and to help parents consider options. Adoption is presented as a loving option, but the decision belongs to the parents; marriage is not mandated.

question_text: Under what condition may a child born to unmarried parents receive a name and a blessing in a sacrament meeting?
answers: If at least one parent or legal guardian is a Church member and approves the blessing
Only if both biological parents are married and endowed
Only if both biological parents consent, regardless of Church membership
Never; such children must wait until baptism at age 8
correct_answer: If at least one parent or legal guardian is a Church member and approves the blessing
explanation: The General Handbook provides that a child may be blessed in sacrament meeting when at least one parent or legal guardian is a member and approves the blessing.

question_text: What change did LDS Family Services announce in 2014 regarding adoption?
answers: It discontinued placing children for adoption and shifted to providing counseling and referrals to community resources
It began placing children only with married Latter-day Saint couples
It expanded to operate its own hospitals for deliveries
It ceased all operations worldwide
correct_answer: It discontinued placing children for adoption and shifted to providing counseling and referrals to community resources
explanation: In 2014, an official Church announcement stated that LDS Family Services would no longer function as an adoption agency, focusing instead on counseling and referrals.

question_text: According to Joseph Smith—History 1:35, how are the Urim and Thummim described?
answers: Two stones set in silver bows and fastened to a breastplate, prepared for translating the record
A brass ball with pointers used to guide Lehi’s family
An iron rod representing the word of God
Gold plates bound with rings
correct_answer: Two stones set in silver bows and fastened to a breastplate, prepared for translating the record
explanation: Joseph Smith—History 1:35 states that two stones in silver bows, fastened to a breastplate, were deposited with the plates and called the Urim and Thummim for translating the book.

question_text: According to Doctrine and Covenants 130:10–11, what is the purpose of the white stone given to the faithful?
answers: It will become a Urim and Thummim whereby things pertaining to a higher order of kingdoms will be made known
It grants authority to perform baptisms for the dead
It is used to determine priesthood callings by lot
It physically illuminates the path to Zion
correct_answer: It will become a Urim and Thummim whereby things pertaining to a higher order of kingdoms will be made known
explanation: D&C 130:10–11 teaches that the white stone mentioned in Revelation 2:17 will become a Urim and Thummim to reveal things pertaining to a higher order of kingdoms.

question_text: In the Old Testament, where were the Urim and Thummim placed according to Exodus 28:30?
answers: In the breastplate of judgment worn by the high priest
Inside the Ark of the Covenant
On the altar of incense
In the tabernacle’s veil
correct_answer: In the breastplate of judgment worn by the high priest
explanation: Exodus 28:30 instructs that the Urim and Thummim be placed in the breastplate of judgment on Aaron’s heart when he goes in before the Lord.

question_text: Which New Testament passage explicitly mentions 'baptism for the dead,' a practice clarified in latter-day revelation as part of vicarious work?
answers: 1 Corinthians 15:29
Romans 6:4
Matthew 28:19
Hebrews 6:2
correct_answer: 1 Corinthians 15:29
explanation: Paul references baptism for the dead in 1 Corinthians 15:29; latter-day revelation (e.g., D&C 127–128) clarifies its practice.

question_text: According to current Church policy, what is the minimum age for a member to participate as a proxy in baptisms for the dead in the temple?
answers: 8 years old
12 years old
16 years old
18 years old
correct_answer: 12 years old
explanation: The General Handbook states that worthy members age 12 and older may be baptized and confirmed as proxies in the temple with a valid recommend.

question_text: What does Latter-day Saint doctrine teach about those for whom proxy ordinances are performed in temples?
answers: They automatically become members of the Church after the ordinance is done.
The ordinances are offered, and the deceased may accept or reject them in the spirit world.
They are resurrected immediately after their names are submitted.
